sentences.zh: 孔子生魯昌平鄉陬邑。

translations.literal: Kong Zi was born in Zou yi of Chang Ping xiang in Lu.

sentences.zh: 其先宋人也，曰孔防叔。

translations.literal: His ancestors were Song people, called Kong Fang Shu.

sentences.zh: 防叔生伯夏，伯夏生叔梁紇。

translations.literal: Fang Shu gave birth to Bo Xia. Bo Xia gave birth to Shu Liang He.

sentences.zh: 紇與顏氏女野合而生孔子，禱於尼丘得孔子。

translations.literal: He had a wild union with a Yan clan woman and gave birth to Kong Zi. They prayed at Ni Qiu and got Kong Zi.

sentences.zh: 魯襄公二十二年而孔子生。

translations.literal: Kong Zi was born in the twenty-second year of Lu Xiang Gong.

sentences.zh: 生而首上圩頂，故因名曰丘云。

translations.literal: He was born with a sunken top to his head, thus he was named Qiu because of this.

sentences.zh: 字仲尼，姓孔氏。

translations.literal: He was styled Zhong Ni and was of the Kong clan.

Confucius was born in Zouyi village, Changping township of Lu. His ancestors were from Song, named Kong Fangshu. Fangshu fathered Bo Xia, Bo Xia fathered Shu Liang He. He mated with a Yan family woman out of wedlock and gave birth to Confucius, having prayed at Ni Hill to obtain Confucius. Confucius was born in the twenty-second year of Duke Xiang of Lu. He was born with a sunken fontanelle on top of his head, so he was named Qiu accordingly. His courtesy name was Zhong Ni, surname Kong.

sentences.zh: 丘生而叔梁紇死，葬於防山。

translations.literal: Qiu was born and Shu Liang He died, buried at Fang Shan.

sentences.zh: 防山在魯東，由是孔子疑其父墓處，母諱之也。

translations.literal: Fang Shan is east of Lu. Thus Kong Zi doubted where his father's grave was - his mother avoided speaking of it.

sentences.zh: 孔子為兒嬉戲，常陳俎豆，設禮容。

translations.literal: When Kong Zi was a child playing, he often arranged the ritual vessels and set the ceremonial appearance.

sentences.zh: 孔子母死，乃殯五父之衢，蓋其慎也。

translations.literal: Kong Zi's mother died, and thus he encoffined her at the Wu Fu crossroads - probably due to his carefulness.

sentences.zh: 郰人輓父之母誨孔子父墓，然後往合葬於防焉。

translations.literal: A Zhu person, the mother of Wan Fu, taught Kong Zi about his father's grave, then he went to jointly bury them at Fang.

Qiu was born and Shu Liang He died, buried at Fang Mountain. Fang Mountain is east of Lu, so Confucius doubted the location of his father's grave, because his mother kept it secret. When Confucius was a child at play, he would always arrange the sacrificial stands and assume ritual postures. When Confucius's mother died, he held the funeral at Wufu crossroads, showing his caution. A Zou person, the mother of Ran You's father, informed Confucius of his father's grave, then he went and joined the burial at Fang.

sentences.zh: 孔子要絰，季氏饗士，孔子與往。

translations.literal: Kong Zi was in mourning. The Ji clan feasted scholars, and Kong Zi went along.

sentences.zh: 陽虎絀曰：「季氏饗士，非敢饗子也。」

translations.literal: Yang Hu rebuked said: 'Ji clan feasts scholars, not dares feast you.'
translations.idiomatic: Yang Hu rebuked him, saying: 'The Ji clan feasts scholars, not daring to feast you.'

sentences.zh: 孔子由是退。

translations.literal: Kong Zi thus withdrew.

Confucius was in mourning attire when the Ji family feasted the scholars, and Confucius went along. Yang Hu rebuked him saying: 'The Ji family feasts the scholars, not daring to feast you.' Confucius thus withdrew.

sentences.zh: 孔子年十七，魯大夫孟釐子病且死，誡其嗣懿子曰：「孔丘，聖人之後，滅於宋。

translations.literal: Kong Zi age seventeen, Lu grand master Meng Xi Zi ill about to die, admonished his successor Yi Zi said: 'Kong Qiu, sage descendants, extinguished in Song.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi at age seventeen, Lu grand master Meng Xi Zi was ill and about to die. He admonished his successor Yi Zi, saying: 'Kong Qiu are descendants of sages, extinguished in Song.'

sentences.zh: 其祖弗父何始有宋而嗣讓厲公。

translations.literal: His ancestor Fu Fu He began having Song and the heir yielded to Li Gong.

sentences.zh: 及正考父佐戴、武、宣公，三命茲益恭，故鼎銘云：『一命而僂，再命而傴，三命而俯，循墻而走，亦莫敢余侮。

translations.literal: And Zheng Kao Fu assisted Dai, Wu, Xuan Gong, three mandates thus increasingly respectful, thus ding inscription says: 'One mandate then hunch, two mandates then bend, three mandates then bow, follow wall walk, also none dare insult me.
translations.idiomatic: And Zheng Kao Fu assisted Dai Gong, Wu Gong, and Xuan Gong. With three mandates he became increasingly respectful. Thus the ding inscription says: 'One mandate then hunch, two mandates then bend, three mandates then bow, follow the wall and walk - also none dare insult me.'

sentences.zh: 饘於是，粥於是，以餬余口。』

translations.literal: Thick congee here, thin congee here, to paste my mouth.'

sentences.zh: 其恭如是。

translations.literal: His respect was like this.

sentences.zh: 吾聞聖人之後，雖不當世，必有達者。

translations.literal: I heard that descendants of sages, though they may not meet their age, must have successful ones.

sentences.zh: 今孔丘年少好禮，其達者歟？

translations.literal: Now Kong Qiu young good ritual, his successful one?
translations.idiomatic: Now Kong Qiu is young and good at ritual - is he the successful one?

sentences.zh: 吾即沒，若必師之。」

translations.literal: I then die, you must take him as teacher.'
translations.idiomatic: When I die, you must take him as teacher.'

sentences.zh: 及釐子卒，懿子與魯人南宮敬叔往學禮焉。

translations.literal: When Xi Zi died, Yi Zi and the Lu person Nan Gong Jing Shu went to study ritual there.

sentences.zh: 是歲，季武子卒，平子代立。

translations.literal: This year, Ji Wu Zi died and Ping Zi succeeded and was established.

At age seventeen, Lu minister Meng Xi Zi was ill and near death, admonishing his heir Yi Zi saying: 'Kong Qiu is a descendant of sages, extinguished in Song. His ancestor Fu Fu He first had Song but yielded to Li Gong. And Zheng Kao Fu assisted Dai, Wu, and Xuan Gong, three summons becoming increasingly respectful, hence the ding inscription says: "One summons and bent, two summons and bowed, three summons and prostrated, following the wall and running, none dare insult me. Rice here, gruel here, to fill my mouth."' His respectfulness was like this. I have heard that descendants of sages, though not contemporary, must have achievers. Now Kong Qiu is young and fond of ritual, is he an achiever? If I die, you must take him as teacher.' When Xi Zi died, Yi Zi and Lu man Nan Gong Jing Shu went to study ritual with him. This year, Ji Wu Zi died, and Ping Zi succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 孔子貧且賤。

translations.literal: Kong Zi was poor and lowly.

sentences.zh: 及長，嘗為季氏史，料量平；

translations.literal: When grown, once was Ji clan scribe, measuring quantities fair;
translations.idiomatic: When grown, he once was the Ji clan's scribe, measuring quantities fairly.

sentences.zh: 嘗為司職吏而畜蕃息。

translations.literal: He once was the Si Zhu official and livestock multiplied.

sentences.zh: 由是為司空。

translations.literal: Thus he became Si Kong.

sentences.zh: 已而去魯，斥乎齊，逐乎宋、衛，困於陳蔡之間，於是反魯。

translations.literal: Then he left Lu, was rejected in Qi, driven from Song and Wei, distressed between Chen and Cai, and thus returned to Lu.

sentences.zh: 孔子長九尺有六寸，人皆謂之「長人」而異之。

translations.literal: Kong Zi height nine chi six cun, people all called him 'tall person' considered him different.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi was nine chi six cun tall. People all called him 'tall person' and considered him different.

sentences.zh: 魯復善待，由是反魯。

translations.literal: Lu again treated him well, and thus he returned to Lu.

Confucius was poor and lowly. When grown, he once served as Ji family accountant, measuring quantities fairly; once served as keeper of stores and increased the livestock. From this he became Director of Works. Then he left Lu, was rejected in Qi, driven out of Song and Wei, besieged between Chen and Cai, then returned to Lu. Confucius was nine chi six cun tall, people all called him 'tall man' and considered him unusual. Lu again treated him well, so he returned to Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯南宮敬叔言魯君曰：「請與孔子適周。」

translations.literal: Lu Nan Gong Jing Shu spoke to Lu lord said: 'Please with Kong Zi go to Zhou.'
translations.idiomatic: Lu's Nan Gong Jing Shu spoke to the Lu lord, saying: 'Please go with Kong Zi to Zhou.'

sentences.zh: 魯君與之一乘車，兩馬，一豎子俱，適周問禮，蓋見老子云。

translations.literal: The Lu lord gave him one carriage, two horses, and one attendant together. He went to Zhou to ask about ritual, and probably saw Lao Zi.

sentences.zh: 辭去，而老子送之曰：「吾聞富貴者送人以財，仁人者送人以言。

translations.literal: Took leave and went, Lao Zi sent him said: 'I heard wealthy noble ones send people with wealth, benevolent ones send people with words.
translations.idiomatic: As he took leave and went, Lao Zi sent him off, saying: 'I heard that wealthy nobles send people off with wealth, benevolent people send people off with words.'

sentences.zh: 吾不能富貴，竊仁人之號，送子以言，曰：『聰明深察而近於死者，好議人者也。

translations.literal: I cannot wealthy noble, steal benevolent person title, send you with words, said: 'Clever deep investigation and near death ones, good criticize people ones.
translations.idiomatic: I cannot be wealthy and noble. I steal the title of benevolent person, and send you off with words, saying: 'Those who are clever, deeply investigate, and approach death - these are people who are good at criticizing others.'

sentences.zh: 博辯廣大危其身者，發人之惡者也。

translations.literal: Broadly argumentative greatly dangerous endanger their person ones, reveal people's evil ones.'
translations.idiomatic: Those who broadly argue and greatly endanger their person - these are people who reveal others' evil.'

sentences.zh: 為人子者毋以有己，為人臣者毋以有己。』」

translations.literal: As person son ones without to have self, as person minister ones without to have self.''
translations.idiomatic: Those who are sons should not have self, those who are ministers should not have self.''

sentences.zh: 孔子自周反于魯，弟子稍益進焉。

translations.literal: Kong Zi returned from Zhou to Lu, and his disciples gradually increasingly advanced there.

Lu's Nan Gong Jing Shu spoke to the Lu lord saying: 'Please go with Confucius to Zhou.' The Lu lord gave him one chariot, two horses, one attendant, went to Zhou to inquire about ritual, reportedly meeting Lao Zi. When leaving, Lao Zi saw him off saying: 'I have heard that the wealthy and noble send people off with wealth, benevolent people send people off with words. I cannot be wealthy and noble, I secretly bear the title of benevolent person, send you off with words, saying: "Those who are clever and deeply perceptive yet close to death are those who like to criticize others. Those who are broadly argumentative and expansive endanger themselves are those who expose others' faults. As a son, do not consider yourself important; as a minister, do not consider yourself important."' Confucius returned from Zhou to Lu, and disciples gradually increased.

sentences.zh: 是時也，晉平公淫，六卿擅權，東伐諸侯；

translations.literal: At this time, Jin Ping Gong licentious, six ministers usurped power, east attacked feudal lords;
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Jin Ping Gong was licentious, the six ministers usurped power, and they attacked the eastern feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 楚靈王兵彊，陵轢中國；

translations.literal: Chu Ling Wang troops strong, overran crushed central states;
translations.idiomatic: Chu Ling Wang's troops were strong, overrunning and crushing the central states.

sentences.zh: 齊大而近於魯。

translations.literal: Qi was great and near to Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯小弱，附於楚則晉怒；

translations.literal: Lu small weak, attach to Chu then Jin angry;
translations.idiomatic: Lu was small and weak. If attached to Chu then Jin would be angry.

sentences.zh: 附於晉則楚來伐；

translations.literal: Attach to Jin then Chu come attack;
translations.idiomatic: If attached to Jin then Chu would come and attack.

sentences.zh: 不備於齊，齊師侵魯。

translations.literal: Without preparing for Qi, Qi troops invaded Lu.

At this time, Jin Ping Gong was licentious, the six ministers monopolized power, attacking eastern feudal lords; Chu Ling Wang's troops were strong, trampling the central states; Qi was large and close to Lu. Lu was small and weak, attaching to Chu angered Jin; attaching to Jin brought Chu to attack; not preparing for Qi brought Qi troops to invade Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯昭公之二十年，而孔子蓋年三十矣。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year of Lu Zhao Gong, Kong Zi was probably thirty years old already.

sentences.zh: 齊景公與晏嬰來適魯，景公問孔子曰：「昔秦穆公國小處辟，其霸何也？」

translations.literal: Qi Jing Gong with Yan Ying came go to Lu, Jing Gong asked Kong Zi said: 'Formerly Qin Mu Gong state small place remote, his hegemony how?'
translations.idiomatic: Qi Jing Gong and Yan Ying came to Lu. Jing Gong asked Kong Zi, saying: 'Formerly Qin Mu Gong's state was small and his place remote - how did he achieve hegemony?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「秦，國雖小，其志大；

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Qin, state though small, its ambition great;
translations.idiomatic: He replied, saying: 'Qin - though the state was small, its ambition was great.'

sentences.zh: 處雖辟，行中正。

translations.literal: Though the place was remote, conduct was upright and proper.

sentences.zh: 身舉五羖，爵之大夫，起纍紲之中，與語三日，授之以政。

translations.literal: He personally raised the five rams, ennobled him as grand master, raised him from the midst of shackles, spoke with him for three days, and entrusted him with government.

sentences.zh: 以此取之，雖王可也，其霸小矣。」

translations.literal: With this obtain it, though king possible, his hegemony small.'
translations.idiomatic: With this to obtain it, though becoming king is possible, his hegemony would be small.'

sentences.zh: 景公說。

translations.literal: Jing Gong was pleased.

In Duke Zhao of Lu's twentieth year, Confucius was about thirty years old. Qi Jing Gong and Yan Ying came to Lu, Jing Gong asked Confucius: 'In the past, Qin Mu Gong's state was small and in a remote place, how did he become hegemon?' He replied: 'Qin, though the state was small, its ambitions were great; though the place was remote, its conduct was upright. He personally selected the five black sheep, ennobled him as a minister, raised him from prison chains, spoke with him for three days, and entrusted him with governance. With this he attained it, though becoming king was possible, his hegemony was but small.' Duke Jing was pleased.

sentences.zh: 孔子年三十五，而季平子與郈昭伯以鬬雞故得罪魯昭公，昭公率師擊平子，平子與孟氏、叔孫氏三家共攻昭公，昭公師敗，奔於齊，齊處昭公乾侯。

translations.literal: Kong Zi was thirty-five years old when Ji Ping Zi and Hou Zhao Bo offended Lu Zhao Gong because of a cockfight matter. Zhao Gong led troops to attack Ping Zi. Ping Zi together with the Meng clan, Shu Sun clan - the three families - attacked Zhao Gong. Zhao Gong's troops were defeated. He fled to Qi, and Qi placed Zhao Gong in Gan Hou.

sentences.zh: 其後頃之，魯亂。

translations.literal: After this, in a short time, Lu was in chaos.

sentences.zh: 孔子適齊，為高昭子家臣，欲以通乎景公。

translations.literal: Kong Zi went to Qi and became Gao Zhao Zi's family minister, wanting to connect with Jing Gong.

sentences.zh: 與齊太師語樂，聞韶音，學之，三月不知肉味，齊人稱之。

translations.literal: He spoke of music with Qi's grand music master, heard the Shao music, studied it, and for three months did not know the taste of meat. The Qi people praised him.

Confucius was thirty-five when Ji Ping Zi and Hou Zhao Bo offended Duke Zhao of Lu over a cockfight, Duke Zhao led troops to attack Ping Zi, Ping Zi together with the Meng and Shusun families attacked Duke Zhao, Duke Zhao's troops were defeated, he fled to Qi, Qi settled him at Qianhou. After a short while, Lu was in chaos. Confucius went to Qi, became a minister in Gao Zhao Zi's household, wishing to gain access to Duke Jing. He discussed music with the Qi Grand Master, heard the Shao music, studied it, for three months did not know the taste of meat, the Qi people praised him.

sentences.zh: 景公問政孔子，孔子曰：「君君，臣臣，父父，子子。」

translations.literal: Jing Gong asked governance Kong Zi, Kong Zi said: 'Lord lord, minister minister, father father, son son.'
translations.idiomatic: Jing Gong asked Kong Zi about governance. Kong Zi said: 'Let the lord be lord, minister be minister, father be father, son be son.'

sentences.zh: 景公曰：「善哉！

translations.literal: Jing Gong said: 'Good!
translations.idiomatic: Jing Gong said: 'Excellent!'

sentences.zh: 信如君不君，臣不臣，父不父，子不子，雖有粟，吾豈得而食諸！」

translations.literal: Indeed if lord not lord, minister not minister, father not father, son not son, though have grain, I how obtain and eat it!'
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, if lords are not lordly, ministers not ministerial, fathers not fatherly, sons not filial - though there be grain, how could I obtain and eat it!'

sentences.zh: 他日又復問政於孔子，孔子曰：「政在節財。」

translations.literal: Another day again asked governance Kong Zi, Kong Zi said: 'Government in economize wealth.'
translations.idiomatic: Another day he again asked Kong Zi about governance. Kong Zi said: 'Government lies in economizing wealth.'

sentences.zh: 景公說，將欲以尼谿田封孔子。

translations.literal: Jing Gong was pleased and was about to enfeoff Kong Zi with Ni Xi fields.

sentences.zh: 晏嬰進曰：「夫儒者滑稽而不可軌法；

translations.literal: Yan Ying advanced said: 'Those scholar ones slippery witty and cannot be regulated;
translations.idiomatic: Yan Ying advanced and said: 'Those scholars are slippery and witty and cannot be regulated.'

sentences.zh: 倨傲自順，不可以為下；

translations.literal: Haughty proud self complacent, cannot be subordinates;
translations.idiomatic: Haughty and proud, self-complacent, they cannot be subordinates.

sentences.zh: 崇喪遂哀，破產厚葬，不可以為俗；

translations.literal: Elevate mourning follow grief, bankrupt thick burial, cannot be custom;
translations.idiomatic: They elevate mourning and follow grief, go bankrupt with thick burials, cannot be custom.

sentences.zh: 游說乞貸，不可以為國。

translations.literal: Wandering about persuading and begging loans, they cannot benefit the state.

sentences.zh: 自大賢之息，周室既衰，禮樂缺有間。

translations.literal: Since the great sage ceased, the Zhou house has already declined, ritual and music have deficiencies with intervals.

sentences.zh: 今孔子盛容飾，繁登降之禮，趨詳之節，累世不能殫其學，當年不能究其禮。

translations.literal: Now Kong Zi flourishes in appearance and adornment, with numerous rituals of ascending and descending, detailed sections of hastening - successive generations cannot exhaust his learning, in a lifetime cannot complete his ritual.

sentences.zh: 君欲用之以移齊俗，非所以先細民也。」

translations.literal: Lord desires use him to shift Qi customs, not what to first small people.'
translations.idiomatic: If you desire to use him to shift Qi customs, this is not what to first do for the small people.'

sentences.zh: 後景公敬見孔子，不問其禮。

translations.literal: Afterwards, Jing Gong respectfully saw Kong Zi but did not ask about his ritual.

sentences.zh: 異日，景公止孔子曰：「奉子以季氏，吾不能。」

translations.literal: Different day, Jing Gong stopped Kong Zi said: 'Support you with Ji clan, I cannot.'
translations.idiomatic: On a different day, Jing Gong stopped Kong Zi and said: 'To support you with the Ji clan, I cannot.'

sentences.zh: 以季孟之間待之。

translations.literal: He treated him as between Ji and Meng.

sentences.zh: 齊大夫欲害孔子，孔子聞之。

translations.literal: The Qi grand masters wanted to harm Kong Zi. Kong Zi heard of it.

sentences.zh: 景公曰：「吾老矣，弗能用也。」

translations.literal: Jing Gong said: 'I old already, cannot use him.'
translations.idiomatic: Jing Gong said: 'I am old already, cannot use him.'

sentences.zh: 孔子遂行，反乎魯。

translations.literal: Kong Zi thus departed and returned to Lu.

Duke Jing asked Confucius about governance, Confucius said: 'The lord acts as lord, the minister as minister, the father as father, the son as son.' Duke Jing said: 'Excellent! If indeed the lord is not lord, minister not minister, father not father, son not son, though there is grain, how could I eat it!' Another day he again asked Confucius about governance, Confucius said: 'Governance lies in economizing expenditures.' Duke Jing was pleased, wished to enfeoff Confucius with Nixi fields. Yan Ying advanced saying: 'Scholars are glib and cannot be made into laws; arrogant and self-satisfied, they cannot serve as subordinates; they honor mourning and pursue grief, ruin their families with lavish burials, they cannot serve as customs; wandering about persuading and begging, they cannot serve the state. From the descendants of great sages, the Zhou house has declined, rituals and music have lapsed for a time. Now Confucius abundantly displays his appearance, multiplies the rituals of ascending and descending, makes detailed the steps of advancing and withdrawing, generations cannot exhaust his learning, in a year cannot complete his rituals. Your lordship wishes to employ him to change Qi customs, this is not how to give precedence to the common people.' After this Duke Jing respectfully received Confucius, but did not question him about ritual. Another day, Duke Jing stopped Confucius saying: 'I cannot present you to the Ji family.' He treated him between the Ji and Meng families. Qi ministers wished to harm Confucius, Confucius heard of it. Duke Jing said: 'I am old, cannot employ him.' Confucius thus departed, returned to Lu.

sentences.zh: 孔子年四十二，魯昭公卒於乾侯，定公立。

translations.literal: Kong Zi was forty-two years old when Lu Zhao Gong died in Gan Hou and Ding Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 定公立五年，夏，季平子卒，桓子嗣立。

translations.literal: In the fifth year of Ding Gong's establishment, summer, Ji Ping Zi died and Huan Zi succeeded and was established.

sentences.zh: 季桓子穿井得土缶，中若羊，問仲尼云「得狗」。

translations.literal: Ji Huan Zi dug well got earthen pot, inside like sheep, asked Zhong Ni said 'got dog'.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Huan Zi dug a well and got an earthen pot. Inside was something like a sheep. He asked Zhong Ni, saying 'got a dog'.

sentences.zh: 仲尼曰：「以丘所聞，羊也。

translations.literal: Zhong Ni said: 'According to Qiu heard, sheep.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Ni said: 'According to what Qiu has heard, it is a sheep.'

sentences.zh: 丘聞之，木石之怪夔、罔閬，水之怪龍、罔象，土之怪墳羊。」

translations.literal: Qiu heard it, wood stone monsters Kui, Wang Lang, water monsters dragon, Wang Xiang, earth monsters Fen Yang.'
translations.idiomatic: Qiu has heard that wood and stone monsters are Kui and Wang Lang, water monsters are dragons and Wang Xiang, earth monsters are Fen Yang.'

translations.literal: Confucius was forty-two, Duke Zhao of Lu died at Qianhou, Duke Ding succeeded. Duke Ding succeeded for five years, summer, Ji Ping Zi died, Huan Zi succeeded. Ji Huan Zi dug a well and obtained an earthen jar, inside resembled a sheep, asked Confucius saying 'got a dog'. Confucius said: 'From what Qiu has heard, a sheep. Qiu has heard that wood and stone monsters are Kui and Wang Liang, water monsters are dragons and Wang Xiang, earth monsters are burial sheep.'

sentences.zh: 吳伐越，墮會稽，得骨節專車。

translations.literal: Wu attacked Yue and fell upon Kui Ji. They got bone joints that filled a cart.

sentences.zh: 吳使使問仲尼：「骨何者最大？」

translations.literal: Wu sent envoy asked Zhong Ni: 'Bone which one greatest?'
translations.idiomatic: Wu sent an envoy to ask Zhong Ni: 'Which bone is the greatest?'

sentences.zh: 仲尼曰：「禹致群神於會稽山，防風氏後至，禹殺而戮之，其節專車，此為大矣。」

translations.literal: Zhong Ni said: 'Yu summoned group spirits at Kui Ji mountain, Fang Feng clan late arrived, Yu killed and displayed him, his joints filled cart, this greatest.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Ni said: 'Yu summoned the group of spirits at Kui Ji mountain. The Fang Feng clan arrived late. Yu killed and displayed him. His joints filled a cart. This is the greatest.'

sentences.zh: 吳客曰：「誰為神？」

translations.literal: Wu guest said: 'Who is god?'
translations.idiomatic: The Wu guest said: 'Who is the god?'

sentences.zh: 仲尼曰：「山川之神足以綱紀天下，其守為神，社稷為公侯，皆屬於王者。」

translations.literal: Zhong Ni said: 'Mountains rivers gods sufficient to outline govern world, their guardians gods, altars nobles, all belong to king.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Ni said: 'The gods of mountains and rivers are sufficient to outline and govern the world. Their guardians are gods, the altars are nobles - all belong to the king.'

sentences.zh: 客曰：「防風何守？」

translations.literal: Guest said: 'Fang Feng what guard?'
translations.idiomatic: The guest said: 'What did Fang Feng guard?'

sentences.zh: 仲尼曰：「汪罔氏之君守封、禺之山，為釐姓。

translations.literal: Zhong Ni said: 'Wang Wang clan lord guarded Feng, Yu mountain, was Li surname.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Ni said: 'The lord of the Wang Wang clan guarded Feng and Yu mountain, and was of the Li surname.'

sentences.zh: 在虞、夏、商為汪罔，於周為長翟，今謂之大人。」

translations.literal: In Yu, Xia, Shang called Wang Wang, in Zhou called Chang Di, now called great people.'
translations.idiomatic: In Yu, Xia, and Shang he was called Wang Wang. In Zhou he was called Chang Di. Now he is called great people.'

sentences.zh: 客曰：「人長幾何？」

translations.literal: Guest said: 'Person tall how much?'
translations.idiomatic: The guest said: 'How tall are the people?'

sentences.zh: 仲尼曰：「僬僥氏三尺，短之至也。

translations.literal: Zhong Ni said: 'Jiao Yao clan three chi, short extreme.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Ni said: 'The Jiao Yao clan are three chi tall - the extreme of shortness.'

sentences.zh: 長者不過十之，數之極也。」

translations.literal: Tall ones not exceed ten times that, number extreme.'
translations.idiomatic: The tall ones do not exceed ten times that - the extreme of numbers.'

sentences.zh: 於是吳客曰：「善哉聖人！」

translations.literal: Thus Wu guest said: 'Good sage!'
translations.idiomatic: Thus the Wu guest said: 'Excellent, sage!'

translations.literal: Wu attacked Yue, destroyed Kuaiji, obtained bone joints filling a cart. Wu sent an envoy to ask Confucius: 'Which bone is the largest?' Confucius said: 'Yu assembled the gods at Kuaiji Mountain, Fangfeng Shi arrived late, Yu killed and exposed him, his joints fill a cart, this is the largest.' The Wu guest said: 'Who are the gods?' Confucius said: 'Mountain and river gods are sufficient to regulate All Under Heaven, their guardians are gods, altars of soil and grain are dukes and marquises, all belong to the Son of Heaven.' The guest said: 'What does Fangfeng guard?' Confucius said: 'The lord of Wang Mang clan guards Mount Feng and Mount Yu, is of Xi surname. In Yu and Xia and Shang he was Wang Mang, in Zhou he is Chang Di, now called the great man.' The guest said: 'How tall are people?' Confucius said: 'The Jiao Yao clan are three chi, the shortest to the utmost. The tallest do not exceed ten times that, the limit of numbers.' Thus the Wu guest said: 'Excellent, sage!'

sentences.zh: 桓子嬖臣曰仲梁懷，與陽虎有隙。

translations.literal: Huan Zi's favored minister was called Zhong Liang Huai, who had enmity with Yang Hu.

sentences.zh: 陽虎欲逐懷，公山不狃止之。

translations.literal: Yang Hu wanted to expel Huai, but Gong Shan Bu Niu stopped him.

sentences.zh: 其秋，懷益驕，陽虎執懷。

translations.literal: That autumn, Huai became increasingly arrogant, and Yang Hu seized Huai.

sentences.zh: 桓子怒，陽虎因囚桓子，與盟而醳之。

translations.literal: Huan Zi was angry. Yang Hu thus imprisoned Huan Zi, made a covenant with him, and released him.

sentences.zh: 陽虎由此益輕季氏。

translations.literal: Yang Hu from this increasingly despised the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 季氏亦僭於公室，陪臣執國政，是以魯自大夫以下皆僭離於正道。

translations.literal: The Ji clan also usurped against the public chamber. Retainers grasped state government. Thus in Lu, from grand masters below, all usurped and departed from the proper way.

sentences.zh: 故孔子不仕，退而脩詩書禮樂，弟子彌眾，至自遠方，莫不受業焉。

translations.literal: Therefore Kong Zi did not serve. He withdrew and cultivated poetry, books, ritual, and music. His disciples became increasingly numerous. They came from distant places, and none failed to receive instruction there.

Huan Zi's favorite minister was Zhong Liang Huai, who was at odds with Yang Hu. Yang Hu wished to expel Huai, Gong Shan Bu Niu stopped him. That autumn, Huai became even more arrogant, Yang Hu seized Huai. Huan Zi was angry, Yang Hu thus imprisoned Huan Zi, made covenant and released him. Yang Hu from this even more disrespected the Ji family. The Ji family also usurped from the ducal house, retainers grasped state power, thus Lu from the great officers down all usurped and departed from the proper way. Therefore Confucius did not serve, retired and studied poetry, documents, rituals, and music, disciples increasingly many, coming from distant places, all received instruction.

sentences.zh: 定公八年，公山不狃不得意於季氏，因陽虎為亂，欲廢三桓之適，更立其庶孽陽虎素所善者，遂執季桓子。

translations.literal: In Ding Gong's eighth year, Gong Shan Bu Niu was displeased with the Ji clan. Because Yang Hu caused chaos, he wanted to abolish the three Huan legitimate heirs and establish instead their concubine bastards whom Yang Hu usually befriended. Thus he seized Ji Huan Zi.

sentences.zh: 桓子詐之，得脫。

translations.literal: Huan Zi deceived him and got away.

sentences.zh: 定公九年，陽虎不勝，奔于齊。

translations.literal: In Ding Gong's ninth year, Yang Hu was not victorious and fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 是時孔子年五十。

translations.literal: At this time Kong Zi was fifty years old.

In Duke Ding's eighth year, Gong Shan Bu Niu was dissatisfied with the Ji family, because of Yang Hu's rebellion, wished to abolish the legitimate heirs of the three Huans, establish Yang Hu's favorites among the concubines, thus seized Ji Huan Zi. Huan Zi deceived him, obtained release. In Duke Ding's ninth year, Yang Hu was defeated, fled to Qi. At this time Confucius was fifty years old.

sentences.zh: 公山不狃以費畔季氏，使人召孔子。

translations.literal: Gong Shan Bu Niu rebelled against the Ji clan with Bi and sent someone to summon Kong Zi.

sentences.zh: 孔子循道彌久，溫溫無所試，莫能己用，曰：「蓋周文武起豐鎬而王，今費雖小，儻庶幾乎！」

translations.literal: Kong Zi followed way increasingly long, gently without place tested, none could employ him, said: 'Probably Zhou Wen Wu arose Feng Hao and became king, now Bi though small, perhaps almost!'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi had followed the way for an increasingly long time, gently without any place to be tested, and none could employ him. He said: 'Probably Zhou Wen and Wu arose from Feng and Hao and became kings. Now Bi, though small, perhaps almost!'

sentences.zh: 欲往。

translations.literal: He wanted to go.

sentences.zh: 子路不說，止孔子。

translations.literal: Zi Lu was not pleased and stopped Kong Zi.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「夫召我者豈徒哉？

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Those who summon me how could in vain?
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Those who summon me - how could it be in vain?'

sentences.zh: 如用我，其為東周乎！」

translations.literal: If employ me, it would become Eastern Zhou!'
translations.idiomatic: If they employ me, it would become an Eastern Zhou!'

sentences.zh: 然亦卒不行。

translations.literal: However, he also finally did not go.

Gong Shan Bu Niu rebelled against the Ji family with Bi, sent someone to summon Confucius. Confucius had followed the Way for a long time, gently without being tested, none could employ him, said: 'Perhaps Zhou Wen and Wu arose from Feng and Hao to become kings, now Bi though small, perhaps I can manage it!' He wished to go. Zi Lu was displeased, stopped Confucius. Confucius said: 'Those who summon me, is it for nothing? If they employ me, it will be an Eastern Zhou!' Yet in the end he did not go.

sentences.zh: 其後定公以孔子為中都宰，一年，四方皆則之。

translations.literal: After this, Ding Gong made Kong Zi governor of Zhong Du. In one year, all four directions followed him.

sentences.zh: 由中都宰為司空，由司空為大司寇。

translations.literal: From governor of Zhong Du he became Si Kong, and from Si Kong he became Grand Si Kou.

After this Duke Ding appointed Confucius as Zhongdu magistrate, in one year the four directions all emulated him. From Zhongdu magistrate he became Director of Works, from Director of Works became Grand Minister of Justice.

sentences.zh: 定公十年春，及齊平。

translations.literal: In Ding Gong's tenth year, spring, they made peace with Qi.

sentences.zh: 夏，齊大夫黎鉏言於景公曰：「魯用孔丘，其勢危齊。」

translations.literal: Summer, Qi grand master Li Chu spoke to Jing Gong said: 'Lu employs Kong Qiu, its power endangers Qi.'
translations.idiomatic: Summer, Qi grand master Li Chu spoke to Jing Gong, saying: 'Lu employs Kong Qiu - its power endangers Qi.'

sentences.zh: 乃使使告魯為好會，會於夾谷。

translations.literal: Thus he sent an envoy to inform Lu of a friendly meeting, to meet at Jia Gu.

sentences.zh: 魯定公且以乘車好往。

translations.literal: Lu Ding Gong was about to go friendly with his carriage.

sentences.zh: 孔子攝相事，曰：「臣聞有文事者必有武備，有武事者必有文備。

translations.literal: Kong Zi acted as chancellor, said: 'Minister heard those who have civil affairs must have martial preparedness, those who have martial affairs must have civil preparedness.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi acted as chancellor and said: 'I have heard that those who have civil affairs must have martial preparedness, and those who have martial affairs must have civil preparedness.'

sentences.zh: 古者諸侯出疆，必具官以從。

translations.literal: In ancient times, when feudal lords left their borders, they must prepare officials to follow.

sentences.zh: 請具左右司馬。」

translations.literal: Please prepare left right Si Ma.'
translations.idiomatic: Please prepare the left and right Si Ma.'

sentences.zh: 定公曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Ding Gong said: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 具左右司馬。

translations.literal: They prepared the left and right Si Ma.

sentences.zh: 會齊侯夾谷，為壇位，土階三等，以會遇之禮相見，揖讓而登。

translations.literal: They met Qi Hou at Jia Gu. They made an altar position with earthen steps of three levels. With the ritual of meeting encounters they saw each other, bowed and yielded, and ascended.

sentences.zh: 獻酬之禮畢，齊有司趨而進曰：「請奏四方之樂。」

translations.literal: Present respond ritual finished, Qi officials hurried advanced said: 'Please perform four directions music.'
translations.idiomatic: The ritual of presenting and responding finished. Qi officials hurried forward and said: 'Please perform the music of the four directions.'

sentences.zh: 景公曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Jing Gong said: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 於是旍旄羽袚矛戟劍撥鼓噪而至。

translations.literal: Thus banners, standards, feather purifiers, spears, halberds, swords, shields, and drums with noise arrived.

sentences.zh: 孔子趨而進，歷階而登，不盡一等，舉袂而言曰：「吾兩君為好會，夷狄之樂何為於此！

translations.literal: Kong Zi hurried advanced, traversed steps ascended, not finished one level, raised sleeve spoke said: 'Our two lords for friendly meeting, Yi Di music why here!
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi hurried forward, traversed the steps and ascended, not finishing one level, raised his sleeve and spoke, saying: 'Our two lords are for a friendly meeting - why is Yi Di music here!'

sentences.zh: 請命有司！」

translations.literal: Please order officials!'
translations.idiomatic: Please order the officials!'

sentences.zh: 有司卻之，不去，則左右視晏子與景公。

translations.literal: The officials repelled them, but they did not leave. Then they looked left and right at Yan Zi and Jing Gong.

sentences.zh: 景公心怍，麾而去之。

translations.literal: Jing Gong was ashamed in heart and waved them away.

sentences.zh: 有頃，齊有司趨而進曰：「請奏宮中之樂。」

translations.literal: After moment, Qi officials hurried advanced said: 'Please perform palace music.'
translations.idiomatic: After a moment, Qi officials hurried forward and said: 'Please perform palace music.'

sentences.zh: 景公曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Jing Gong said: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 優倡侏儒為戲而前。

translations.literal: Actors and dwarfs made jokes and advanced.

sentences.zh: 孔子趨而進，歷階而登，不盡一等，曰：「匹夫而營惑諸侯者罪當誅！

translations.literal: Kong Zi hurried advanced, traversed steps ascended, not finished one level, said: 'Common man yet deceives feudal lords crime should execute!
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi hurried forward, traversed the steps and ascended, not finishing one level, and said: 'A common man who deceives feudal lords - his crime should be execution!'

sentences.zh: 請命有司！」

translations.literal: Please order officials!'
translations.idiomatic: Please order the officials!'

sentences.zh: 有司加法焉，手足異處。

translations.literal: The officials applied the law there, and hands and feet were in different places.

sentences.zh: 景公懼而動，知義不若，歸而大恐，告其群臣曰：「魯以君子之道輔其君，而子獨以夷狄之道教寡人，使得罪於魯君，為之奈何？」

translations.literal: Jing Gong feared moved, knew righteousness not equal, returned greatly feared, told his ministers said: 'Lu with gentleman way assists its lord, yet you alone with Yi Di way teach me, made me offend Lu lord, what to do?'
translations.idiomatic: Jing Gong was fearful and moved. He knew his righteousness was not equal. He returned greatly fearful and told his ministers, saying: 'Lu assists its lord with the way of gentlemen, yet you alone teach me with the way of Yi Di, making me offend the Lu lord - what to do?'

sentences.zh: 有司進對曰：「君子有過則謝以質，小人有過則謝以文。

translations.literal: Officials advanced replied said: 'Gentlemen have fault then apologize with substance, small people have fault then apologize with words.
translations.idiomatic: The officials advanced and replied, saying: 'When gentlemen have faults, they apologize with substance. When small people have faults, they apologize with words.'

sentences.zh: 君若悼之，則謝以質。」

translations.literal: Lord if regrets it, then apologize with substance.'
translations.idiomatic: If you regret it, then apologize with substance.'

sentences.zh: 於是齊侯乃歸所侵魯之鄆、汶陽、龜陰之田以謝過。

translations.literal: Thus Qi Hou then returned the fields of Yun, Wen Yang, and Gui Yin that he had invaded from Lu to apologize for the fault.

In Duke Ding's tenth year spring, made peace with Qi. Summer, Qi minister Li Chu spoke to Duke Jing saying: 'Lu employs Kong Qiu, this threatens Qi.' Thus sent an envoy to inform Lu of a friendly meeting, meeting at Jiagu. Duke Ding of Lu was about to go with a chariot in friendship. Confucius acted as prime minister, said: 'I have heard that those who have civil affairs must have military preparations, those who have military affairs must have civil preparations. In ancient times when feudal lords left their territory, they must have complete officials accompany them. Please prepare left and right marshals.' Duke Ding said: 'Very well.' Prepared left and right marshals. Met the Qi duke at Jiagu, established altar positions, earthen steps three levels, met with meeting etiquette, bowed and yielded and ascended. The offering and toasting rituals completed, Qi officials hurried forward saying: 'Please perform the music of the four directions.' Duke Jing said: 'Very well.' Thus banners, yak tails, feathers, halberds, spears, swords, shields, drums, and shouting arrived. Confucius hurried forward, ascended the steps without completing one level, raised his sleeve and spoke: 'Our two lords make a friendly meeting, why is barbarian music here! Please command the officials!' The officials repelled them, they did not leave, then looked left and right at Yan Ying and Duke Jing. Duke Jing was ashamed in heart, waved them away. After a while, Qi officials hurried forward saying: 'Please perform inner palace music.' Duke Jing said: 'Very well.' Actors and dwarfs performed plays and advanced. Confucius hurried forward, ascended the steps without completing one level, said: 'Common fellows who deceive feudal lords, their crime deserves execution! Please command the officials!' The officials applied the law, hands and feet separated. Duke Jing was fearful and moved, knew righteousness was inferior, returned and greatly feared, told his ministers: 'Lu assists its lord with the way of gentlemen, but you alone teach me the way of barbarians, causing me to offend the Lu lord, what can be done?' The officials advanced replying: 'Gentlemen apologize for mistakes with sincerity, petty men apologize for mistakes with words. If your lordship regrets it, then apologize with sincerity.' Thus the Qi duke returned the invaded Lu territories of Yun, Wen Yang, and Gui Yin to apologize for the offense.

sentences.zh: 定公十三年夏，孔子言於定公曰：「臣無藏甲，大夫毋百雉之城。」

translations.literal: Ding Gong thirteenth year summer, Kong Zi spoke to Ding Gong said: 'Ministers without hidden armor, grand masters without hundred moat cities.'
translations.idiomatic: In Ding Gong's thirteenth year, summer, Kong Zi spoke to Ding Gong, saying: 'Ministers should have no hidden armor, grand masters should have no cities of a hundred moats.'

sentences.zh: 使仲由為季氏宰，將墮三都。

translations.literal: He made Zhong You governor of the Ji clan and was about to demolish the three cities.

sentences.zh: 於是叔孫氏先墮郈。

translations.literal: Thus the Shu Sun clan first demolished Hou.

sentences.zh: 季氏將墮費，公山不狃、叔孫輒率費人襲魯。

translations.literal: The Ji clan was about to demolish Bi when Gong Shan Bu Niu and Shu Sun Zhe led the Bi people to attack Lu.

sentences.zh: 公與三子入于季氏之宮，登武子之臺。

translations.literal: The duke and the three sons entered the Ji clan palace and ascended Wu Zi's tower.

sentences.zh: 費人攻之，弗克，入及公側。

translations.literal: The Bi people attacked them but could not conquer. They entered and reached the duke's side.

sentences.zh: 孔子命申句須、樂頎下伐之，費人北。

translations.literal: Kong Zi ordered Shen Gou Xu and Yue Yi to descend and attack them. The Bi people went north.

sentences.zh: 國人追之，敗諸姑蔑。

translations.literal: The state people pursued them and defeated them at Gu Mie.

sentences.zh: 二子奔齊，遂墮費。

translations.literal: The two sons fled to Qi, and thus Bi was demolished.

sentences.zh: 將墮成，公斂處父謂孟孫曰：「墮成，齊人必至于北門。

translations.literal: About to demolish Cheng, Gong Lian Chu Fu told Meng Sun said: 'Demolish Cheng, Qi people must reach north gate.
translations.idiomatic: They were about to demolish Cheng when Gong Lian Chu Fu told Meng Sun, saying: 'If we demolish Cheng, the Qi people will certainly reach the north gate.'

sentences.zh: 且成，孟氏之保鄣，無成是無孟氏也。

translations.literal: Moreover, Cheng is the Meng clan's protective barrier. Without Cheng, there is no Meng clan.

sentences.zh: 我將弗墮。」

translations.literal: I will not demolish it.'

sentences.zh: 十二月，公圍成，弗克。

translations.literal: In the twelfth month, the duke besieged Cheng but could not conquer it.

In Duke Ding's thirteenth year summer, Confucius spoke to Duke Ding: 'Ministers should not store armor, great officers should not have cities of one hundred mou.' Had Zhong You serve as Ji family magistrate, about to destroy the three cities. Thus the Shusun family first destroyed Hou. The Ji family was about to destroy Bi, Gong Shan Bu Niu and Shusun Zhe led the Bi people to attack Lu. The duke and the three families entered the Ji family palace, ascended Wu Zi's terrace. The Bi people attacked them, could not conquer, entered and reached the duke's side. Confucius ordered Shen Ju Xu and Yue Yi to descend and attack them, the Bi people fled north. The state people pursued them, defeated them at Gu Mie. The two men fled to Qi, thus destroyed Bi. About to destroy Cheng, Duke Lian Chu Fu told Meng Sun: 'Destroying Cheng, the Qi people will certainly reach the north gate. Moreover Cheng is the Meng family's protective barrier, without Cheng there is no Meng family. I will not destroy it.' Twelfth month, the duke besieged Cheng but could not conquer it.

sentences.zh: 定公十四年，孔子年五十六，由大司寇行攝相事，有喜色。

translations.literal: In Ding Gong's fourteenth year, Kong Zi was fifty-six years old. From Grand Si Kou he acted as chancellor affairs and had a happy expression.

sentences.zh: 門人曰：「聞君子禍至不懼，福至不喜。」

translations.literal: Disciples said: 'Heard gentlemen calamity arrive not fear, fortune arrive not rejoice.'
translations.idiomatic: The disciples said: 'I have heard that gentlemen do not fear when calamity arrives, and do not rejoice when fortune arrives.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「有是言也。

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'There is this saying.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'There is this saying.'

sentences.zh: 不曰『樂其以貴下人』乎？」

translations.literal: Not said 'rejoice because noble lowers to people'?'
translations.idiomatic: Is it not said, 'Rejoice because the noble lowers himself to people'?'

sentences.zh: 於是誅魯大夫亂政者少正卯。

translations.literal: Thus he executed the Lu grand master who disturbed government, Shao Zheng Mao.

sentences.zh: 與聞國政三月，粥羔豚者弗飾賈；

translations.literal: Participated in state government three months, sold lambs pigs not falsely priced;
translations.idiomatic: He participated in state government for three months. Those who sold lambs and pigs did not falsely price them.

sentences.zh: 男女行者別於塗；

translations.literal: Men women walkers separated on roads;
translations.idiomatic: Men and women walkers were separated on the roads.

sentences.zh: 塗不拾遺；

translations.literal: Roads not picked up lost things;
translations.idiomatic: Lost things on the roads were not picked up.

sentences.zh: 四方之客至乎邑者不求有司，皆予之以歸。

translations.literal: Guests from the four directions who arrived at the cities did not seek officials - all were given what they needed to return.

Duke Ding's fourteenth year, Confucius was fifty-six, from Grand Minister of Justice acted as prime minister, showing happy expression. Disciples said: 'We have heard that gentlemen do not fear when disaster comes, do not rejoice when fortune arrives.' Confucius said: 'There are these words. Does it not say "delight in using nobility to humble oneself"?' Thus he executed Lu minister who disturbed the government, Shao Zheng Mao. Participated in national affairs three months, those selling lambs and pigs did not inflate prices; men and women walking kept to separate paths; nothing was picked up and kept from the roads; travelers from the four directions arriving at towns did not seek officials, all given what they needed to return home.

sentences.zh: 齊人聞而懼，曰：「孔子為政必霸，霸則吾地近焉，我之為先并矣。

translations.literal: Qi people heard feared, said: 'Kong Zi governs must become hegemon, hegemon then our land near, we will be first annexed.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi people heard and were fearful, saying: 'If Kong Zi governs, he will certainly become hegemon. If he becomes hegemon, our land is near - we will be the first annexed.'

sentences.zh: 盍致地焉？」

translations.literal: Why not send land there?'

sentences.zh: 黎鉏曰：「請先嘗沮之；

translations.literal: Li Chu said: 'Please first try obstruct him;
translations.idiomatic: Li Chu said: 'Please first try to obstruct him.'

sentences.zh: 沮之而不可則致地，庸遲乎！」

translations.literal: Obstruct him if cannot then send land, how late!'
translations.idiomatic: If obstructing him does not work, then send land - how could it be too late!'

sentences.zh: 於是選齊國中女子好者八十人，皆衣文衣而舞康樂，文馬三十駟，遺魯君。

translations.literal: Thus they selected eighty beautiful women from Qi state, all wearing patterned clothes and dancing Kang Le, with thirty teams of patterned horses, and sent them to the Lu lord.

sentences.zh: 陳女樂文馬於魯城南高門外，季桓子微服往觀再三，將受，乃語魯君為周道游，往觀終日，怠於政事。

translations.literal: They displayed the female musicians and patterned horses outside the high gate south of Lu city. Ji Huan Zi, in disguise, went to view them repeatedly. He was about to accept them, then told the Lu lord it was for a Zhou Dao excursion. He went to view them the whole day and neglected government affairs.

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「夫子可以行矣。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Master can depart.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu said: 'Master, you can depart now.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「魯今且郊，如致膰乎大夫，則吾猶可以止。」

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Lu now about to suburban sacrifice, if send sacrificial meat to grand masters, then I still can stay.'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Lu is now about to perform the suburban sacrifice. If they send sacrificial meat to the grand masters, then I can still stay.'

sentences.zh: 桓子卒受齊女樂，三日不聽政；

translations.literal: Huan Zi finally accepted Qi female musicians, three days not attended government;
translations.idiomatic: Huan Zi finally accepted the Qi female musicians and did not attend to government for three days.

sentences.zh: 郊，又不致膰俎於大夫。

translations.literal: At the suburban sacrifice, moreover, they did not send sacrificial meat stands to the grand masters.

sentences.zh: 孔子遂行，宿乎屯。

translations.literal: Kong Zi thus departed and lodged at Tun.

sentences.zh: 而師己送，曰：「夫子則非罪。」

translations.literal: Shi Ji sent him off, said: 'Master then not at fault.'
translations.idiomatic: Shi Ji sent him off, saying: 'Master, you are not at fault.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「吾歌可夫？」

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'My song acceptable?'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Is my song acceptable?'

sentences.zh: 歌曰：「彼婦之口，可以出走；

translations.literal: Song said: 'That woman's mouth, can make one flee;
translations.idiomatic: He sang: 'That woman's mouth can make one flee.'

sentences.zh: 彼婦之謁，可以死敗。

translations.literal: That woman's petition, can cause death ruin.
translations.idiomatic: That woman's petition can cause death and ruin.'

sentences.zh: 蓋優哉游哉，維以卒歲！」

translations.literal: Alas leisurely wandering, only thus end year!'
translations.idiomatic: Alas, leisurely wandering - only thus to end the year!'

sentences.zh: 師己反，桓子曰：「孔子亦何言？」

translations.literal: Shi Ji returned, Huan Zi said: 'Kong Zi also what said?'
translations.idiomatic: Shi Ji returned. Huan Zi said: 'What did Kong Zi say?'

sentences.zh: 師己以實告。

translations.literal: Shi Ji truthfully told him.

sentences.zh: 桓子喟然嘆曰：「夫子罪我以群婢故也夫！」

translations.literal: Huan Zi sighed deeply said: 'Master blames me because of the group of concubines!'
translations.idiomatic: Huan Zi sighed deeply and said: 'The master blames me because of the group of concubines!'

translations.literal: Qi people heard and feared, said: 'If Confucius governs he will certainly become hegemon, if hegemon then our territory is close, we will be the first annexed. Why not offer territory?' Li Chu said: 'Please first try to obstruct him; if obstructing him proves impossible then offer territory, how late would that be!' Thus selected eighty beautiful women from Qi, all clothed in embroidered garments dancing Kang Le, thirty teams of fine horses, sent to Lu lord. Displayed female musicians and fine horses outside Lu city's south high gate, Ji Huan Zi in plain clothes went to view several times, about to accept, then told Lu lord to travel Zhou roads, went to view all day, neglected government affairs. Zi Lu said: 'Master can leave.' Confucius said: 'Lu now will perform the suburban sacrifice, if they offer the sacrificial meat to ministers, then I can still remain.' Huan Zi finally accepted Qi's female musicians, three days did not attend to government; at the suburban sacrifice, also did not offer sacrificial meats to ministers. Confucius thus left, lodged at Tun. Shi Yi sent him off, said: 'Master is not at fault.' Confucius said: 'May I sing?' Sang: 'That woman's mouth can make one flee; that woman's flattery can lead to death and defeat. Alas, wandering wandering, just to end the year!' Shi Yi returned, Huan Zi said: 'What did Confucius say?' Shi Yi truthfully told him. Huan Zi sighed deeply: 'Master blames me because of the female slaves!'

sentences.zh: 孔子遂適衛，主於子路妻兄顏濁鄒家。

translations.literal: Kong Zi thus went to Wei and lodged at the home of Zi Lu's wife's brother, Yan Zhuo Zou.

sentences.zh: 衛靈公問孔子：「居魯得祿幾何？」

translations.literal: Wei Ling Gong asked Kong Zi: 'Dwelt Lu got salary how much?'
translations.idiomatic: Wei Ling Gong asked Kong Zi: 'When you dwelt in Lu, how much salary did you get?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「奉粟六萬。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Received grain sixty thousand.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied, saying: 'I received sixty thousand measures of grain.'

sentences.zh: 衛人亦致粟六萬。

translations.literal: The Wei people also sent sixty thousand measures of grain.

sentences.zh: 居頃之，或譖孔子於衛靈公。

translations.literal: After dwelling a short time, someone slandered Kong Zi to Wei Ling Gong.

sentences.zh: 靈公使公孫余假一出一入。

translations.literal: Ling Gong made Gong Sun Yu monitor his comings and goings.

sentences.zh: 孔子恐獲罪焉，居十月，去衛。

translations.literal: Kong Zi feared he would obtain fault there. He dwelt ten months and left Wei.

Confucius thus went to Wei, stayed at Zi Lu's wife's brother Yan Zhu Zou's home. Wei Ling Gong asked Confucius: 'When living in Lu, how much salary did you receive?' Replied: 'Six hundred thousand bushels of grain.' Wei people also gave six hundred thousand bushels. After staying a while, someone slandered Confucius to Wei Ling Gong. Ling Gong made Gong Sun Yu monitor his comings and goings. Confucius feared being convicted, after ten months, left Wei.

sentences.zh: 將適陳，過匡，顏刻為僕，以其策指之曰：「昔吾入此，由彼缺也。」

translations.literal: About to go to Chen, passed Kuang, Yan Ke as servant, with his whip pointed said: 'Formerly I entered here, by that breach.'
translations.idiomatic: He was about to go to Chen and passed through Kuang. Yan Ke was his servant. With his whip he pointed and said: 'Formerly I entered here through that breach.'

sentences.zh: 匡人聞之，以為魯之陽虎。

translations.literal: The Kuang people heard it and thought it was Lu's Yang Hu.

sentences.zh: 陽虎嘗暴匡人，匡人於是遂止孔子。

translations.literal: Yang Hu had once tyrannized the Kuang people. The Kuang people thus then stopped Kong Zi.

sentences.zh: 孔子狀類陽虎，拘焉五日，顏淵後，子曰：「吾以汝為死矣。」

translations.literal: Kong Zi appearance resembled Yang Hu, imprisoned there five days, Yan Yuan late, master said: 'I thought you dead.'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi's appearance resembled Yang Hu. He was imprisoned there for five days. Yan Yuan arrived late. The master said: 'I thought you were dead.'

sentences.zh: 顏淵曰：「子在，回何敢死！」

translations.literal: Yan Yuan said: 'Master is here, Hui how dare die!'
translations.idiomatic: Yan Yuan said: 'While the master is here, how would Hui dare to die!'

sentences.zh: 匡人拘孔子益急，弟子懼。

translations.literal: The Kuang people imprisoned Kong Zi with increasing urgency. The disciples feared.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「文王既沒，文不在茲乎？

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Wen Wang already deceased, culture not here?
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Wen Wang has already passed away. Is the culture not here?'

sentences.zh: 天之將喪斯文也，後死者不得與于斯文也。

translations.literal: If heaven is going to lose this culture, those who die later cannot participate in this culture.'

sentences.zh: 天之未喪斯文也，匡人其如予何！」

translations.literal: Heaven not yet lost this culture, Kuang people how can they do to me!'
translations.idiomatic: If heaven has not yet lost this culture, what can the Kuang people do to me!'

sentences.zh: 孔子使從者為甯武子臣於衛，然後得去。

translations.literal: Kong Zi made a follower become Ning Wu Zi's minister in Wei, and then he got to leave.

About to go to Chen, passed through Kuang, Yan Ke as servant, pointed with his whip saying: 'Formerly I entered here, through that gap.' Kuang people heard it, thought he was Lu's Yang Hu. Yang Hu had once oppressed Kuang people, Kuang people thus stopped Confucius. Confucius's appearance resembled Yang Hu, imprisoned five days, Yan Yuan arrived later, Confucius said: 'I thought you had died.' Yan Yuan said: 'Master is here, how dare I die!' Kuang people imprisoned Confucius even more urgently, disciples feared. Confucius said: 'Since King Wen has passed, is culture not here? If Heaven will lose this culture, later deaths cannot participate in this culture. If Heaven has not lost this culture, what can Kuang people do to me!' Confucius made followers serve as Ning Wu Zi's ministers in Wei, then was able to leave.

sentences.zh: 去即過蒲。

translations.literal: After leaving, he then passed through Pu.

sentences.zh: 月餘，反乎衛，主蘧伯玉家。

translations.literal: After more than a month, he returned to Wei and lodged at Qu Bo Yu's home.

sentences.zh: 靈公夫人有南子者，使人謂孔子曰：「四方之君子不辱欲與寡君為兄弟者，必見寡小君。

translations.literal: Ling Gong lady had Nan Zi, sent person told Kong Zi said: 'Four directions gentlemen not ashamed desire with my lord be brothers ones, must see my little lord.
translations.idiomatic: Ling Gong's lady had Nan Zi. She sent someone to tell Kong Zi, saying: 'Gentlemen from the four directions who are not ashamed and desire to be brothers with my lord must see my little lord.'

sentences.zh: 寡小君願見。」

translations.literal: My little lord wishes to see.'

sentences.zh: 孔子辭謝，不得已而見之。

translations.literal: Kong Zi declined with thanks but had no choice and saw her.

sentences.zh: 夫人在絺帷中。

translations.literal: The lady was in the midst of thin curtains.

sentences.zh: 孔子入門，北面稽首。

translations.literal: Kong Zi entered the gate, faced north, and bowed his head to the ground.

sentences.zh: 夫人自帷中再拜，環珮玉聲璆然。

translations.literal: The lady from within the curtain bowed twice. The sound of her jade pendants was clear.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「吾鄉為弗見，見之禮答焉。」

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'I wished not to see, seeing it ritual respond there.'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'I wished not to see. Having seen, I respond with the ritual.'

sentences.zh: 子路不說。

translations.literal: Zi Lu was not pleased.

sentences.zh: 孔子矢之曰：「予所不者，天厭之！

translations.literal: Kong Zi swore said: 'What I do not approve, heaven detest it!
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi swore, saying: 'What I do not approve - heaven detest it!'

sentences.zh: 天厭之！」

translations.literal: Heaven detest it!'

sentences.zh: 居衛月餘，靈公與夫人同車，宦者雍渠參乘，出，使孔子為次乘，招搖市過之。

translations.literal: After dwelling in Wei more than a month, Ling Gong rode in the same carriage with his lady. The eunuch Yong Qu was in the right seat. They went out and made Kong Zi ride in the secondary carriage, flaunting through the market as they passed.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「吾未見好德如好色者也。」

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'I have not seen love virtue like love beauty ones.'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'I have not seen anyone who loves virtue like they love beauty.'

sentences.zh: 於是醜之，去衛，過曹。

translations.literal: Thus he despised it, left Wei, and passed through Cao.

sentences.zh: 是歲，魯定公卒。

translations.literal: This year, Lu Ding Gong died.

Left and passed through Pu. Over a month, returned to Wei, stayed at Qu Bo Yu's home. Wei Ling Gong's wife was named Nan Zi, she sent someone to tell Confucius: 'Gentlemen from the four directions who do not consider it humiliating to become brothers with my lord must see my little lord. My little lord wishes to see.' Confucius declined politely, but had no choice and saw her. The wife was in thin curtains. Confucius entered the gate, faced north and bowed with hands to ground. The wife bowed twice from within the curtains, her jade pendants clinking. Confucius said: 'I wished not to see, having seen I respond with ritual.' Zi Lu was displeased. Confucius swore saying: 'If I have done wrong, Heaven reject me! Heaven reject me!' After staying in Wei over a month, Ling Gong and his wife rode in the same chariot, eunuch Yong Qu was the passenger, went out, made Confucius the next chariot, swaggered through the market past him. Confucius said: 'I have never seen one who loves virtue like loving beauty.' Thus he despised it and left Wei, passing through Cao. This year, Lu Ding Gong died.

sentences.zh: 孔子去曹適宋，與弟子習禮大樹下。

translations.literal: Kong Zi left Cao and went to Song, where he practiced ritual with his disciples under a big tree.

sentences.zh: 宋司馬桓魋欲殺孔子，拔其樹。

translations.literal: Song's Si Ma Huan Dai wanted to kill Kong Zi and uprooted the tree.

sentences.zh: 孔子去。

translations.literal: Kong Zi left.

sentences.zh: 弟子曰：「可以速矣。」

translations.literal: Disciples said: 'Can hasten.'
translations.idiomatic: The disciples said: 'We can hasten.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「天生德於予，桓魋其如予何！」

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Heaven born virtue in me, Huan Dai how can he do to me!'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Heaven has born virtue in me. What can Huan Dai do to me!'

translations.literal: Confucius left Cao for Song, practicing ritual with disciples under a large tree. Song commander Huan Tui wanted to kill Confucius, chopped down his tree. Confucius left. Disciples said: 'We can hurry.' Confucius said: 'Heaven has endowed virtue in me, what can Huan Tui do to me!'

sentences.zh: 孔子適鄭，與弟子相失，孔子獨立郭東門。

translations.literal: Kong Zi went to Zheng and became separated from his disciples. Kong Zi alone stood at the outer wall's east gate.

sentences.zh: 鄭人或謂子貢曰：「東門有人，其顙似堯，其項類皋陶，其肩類子產，然自要以下不及禹三寸。

translations.literal: Zheng person someone told Zi Gong said: 'East gate has person, his forehead like Yao, his neck like Gao Tao, his shoulders like Zi Chan, however from waist below not reach Yu three cun.
translations.idiomatic: A Zheng person told Zi Gong, saying: 'At the east gate there is a person whose forehead resembles Yao, whose neck resembles Gao Tao, whose shoulders resemble Zi Chan, but from the waist down he does not reach Yu by three cun.'

sentences.zh: 纍纍若喪家之狗。」

translations.literal: Dejected like lost home dog.'
translations.idiomatic: Dejected like a dog that has lost its home.'

sentences.zh: 子貢以實告孔子。

translations.literal: Zi Gong truthfully told Kong Zi.

sentences.zh: 孔子欣然笑曰：「形狀，末也。

translations.literal: Kong Zi happily laughed said: 'Shape appearance, insignificant.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi laughed happily and said: 'Shape and appearance are insignificant.'

sentences.zh: 而謂似喪家之狗，然哉！

translations.literal: Yet say resembles lost home dog, truly!
translations.idiomatic: Yet to say he resembles a dog that has lost its home - truly!'

sentences.zh: 然哉！」

translations.literal: Truly!'

Confucius went to Zheng, became separated from his disciples, Confucius stood alone at the eastern gate of the outer wall. A Zheng person told Zi Gong: 'There is a man at the eastern gate, his forehead resembles Yao, his neck resembles Gao Tao, his shoulders resemble Zi Chan, but from the waist down he is three cun shorter than Yu. Wearily like a homeless dog.' Zi Gong truthfully told Confucius. Confucius smiled happily and said: 'Appearance is superficial. But to say resembling a homeless dog, yes indeed! Yes indeed!'

sentences.zh: 孔子遂至陳，主於司城貞子家。

translations.literal: Kong Zi thus arrived in Chen and lodged at Si Cheng Zhen Zi's home.

sentences.zh: 歲餘，吳王夫差伐陳，取三邑而去。

translations.literal: After more than a year, Wu king Fu Chai attacked Chen, took three cities, and left.

sentences.zh: 趙鞅伐朝歌。

translations.literal: Zhao Yang attacked Zhao Ge.

sentences.zh: 楚圍蔡，蔡遷于吳。

translations.literal: Chu besieged Cai, and Cai moved to Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳敗越王句踐會稽。

translations.literal: Wu defeated Yue king Gou Jian at Kui Ji.

Confucius arrived at Chen, staying at the home of Director of Construction Zhen Zi. Over a year, Wu King Fu Chai attacked Chen, took three cities and left. Zhao Yang attacked Zhaoge. Chu besieged Cai, Cai moved to Wu. Wu defeated Yue King Gou Jian at Kuaiji.

sentences.zh: 有隼集于陳廷而死，楛矢貫之，石砮，矢長尺有咫。

translations.literal: A falcon gathered at the Chen court and died. A birch arrow pierced it, with a stone arrowhead. The arrow was one chi eight cun long.

sentences.zh: 陳湣公使使問仲尼。

translations.literal: Chen Min Gong sent an envoy to ask Zhong Ni.

sentences.zh: 仲尼曰：「隼來遠矣，此肅慎之矢也。

translations.literal: Zhong Ni said: 'Falcon came from far, this Su Shen arrow.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Ni said: 'The falcon came from far away. This is a Su Shen arrow.'

sentences.zh: 昔武王克商，通道九夷百蠻，使各以其方賄來貢，使無忘職業。

translations.literal: Formerly Wu Wang conquered Shang and opened the way for the nine Yi and hundred Man tribes. He made each bring tribute from their direction to contribute, so they would not forget their occupations.

sentences.zh: 於是肅慎貢楛矢石砮，長尺有咫。

translations.literal: Thus the Su Shen contributed birch arrows with stone arrowheads, one chi eight cun long.

sentences.zh: 先王欲昭其令德，以肅慎矢分大姬，配虞胡公而封諸陳。

translations.literal: The former kings wanted to manifest their excellent virtue. With Su Shen arrows they divided Da Ji, matched her with Yu Hu Gong, and sealed them at Chen.

sentences.zh: 分同姓以珍玉，展親；

translations.literal: Divided same surname with precious jade, displayed kinship;
translations.idiomatic: They divided the same surname with precious jade to display kinship.

sentences.zh: 分異姓以遠職，使無忘服。

translations.literal: They divided different surnames with distant duties so they would not forget submission.

sentences.zh: 故分陳以肅慎矢。」

translations.literal: Thus divided Chen with Su Shen arrows.'
translations.idiomatic: Thus they divided Chen with Su Shen arrows.'

sentences.zh: 試求之故府，果得之。

translations.literal: They tried seeking in the old treasury and indeed obtained it.

A falcon gathered in the Chen court and died, pierced by a hu arrow, stone point, the arrow a chi and eight cun long. Chen Min Gong sent an envoy to ask Confucius. Confucius said: 'The falcon came from afar, this is a Su Shen arrow. In the past when King Wu conquered Shang, he opened roads to the nine Yi and hundred Man, made each bring their local tribute to contribute, so they would not forget their duties. Thus Su Shen contributed hu arrows and stone points, a chi and eight cun long. The former kings wished to display their excellent virtue, divided the Su Shen arrows to give to Da Ji, matched with Yu Hu Gong and enfeoffed them at Chen. Divided same surnames with precious jade to display closeness; divided different surnames with distant duties so they would not forget submission. Therefore divided Chen with Su Shen arrows.' They tried seeking in the old treasury, indeed found them.

sentences.zh: 孔子居陳三歲，會晉楚爭彊，更伐陳，及吳侵陳，陳常被寇。

translations.literal: Kong Zi dwelt in Chen for three years. He met with Jin and Chu contending for strength, alternately attacking Chen, and Wu invading Chen. Chen constantly suffered from bandits.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「歸與！

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Return!
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Let us return!'

sentences.zh: 歸與！

translations.literal: Return!
translations.idiomatic: Let us return!'

sentences.zh: 吾黨之小子狂簡，進取不忘其初。」

translations.literal: My party youths mad simple, advance take not forget their beginning.'
translations.idiomatic: The youths of my party are madly simple. When they advance and take, they do not forget their beginning.'

sentences.zh: 於是孔子去陳。

translations.literal: Thus Kong Zi left Chen.

Confucius stayed in Chen three years, when Jin and Chu contended for strength, alternately attacking Chen, and Wu invaded Chen, Chen was constantly raided. Confucius said: 'Return home! Return home! My party's youths are simple and ardent, advancing and gaining without forgetting their beginnings.' Thus Confucius left Chen.

sentences.zh: 過蒲，會公叔氏以蒲畔，蒲人止孔子。

translations.literal: He passed through Pu and met with the Gong Shu clan rebelling with Pu. The Pu people stopped Kong Zi.

sentences.zh: 弟子有公良孺者，以私車五乘從孔子。

translations.literal: Among the disciples was Gong Liang Ru, who followed Kong Zi with five private chariots.

sentences.zh: 其為人長賢，有勇力，謂曰：「吾昔從夫子遇難於匡，今又遇難於此，命也已。

translations.literal: His person tall virtuous, had brave strength, told said: 'I formerly followed master met difficulty at Kuang, now again met difficulty here, fate already.
translations.idiomatic: He was tall and virtuous, had brave strength. He said: 'I formerly followed the master and met difficulty at Kuang. Now I again meet difficulty here. It is fate already.'

sentences.zh: 吾與夫子再罹難，寧鬬而死。」

translations.literal: I with master twice suffered difficulty, rather fight die.'
translations.idiomatic: I with the master have twice suffered difficulty. I would rather fight and die.'

sentences.zh: 鬬甚疾。

translations.literal: They fought extremely fiercely.

sentences.zh: 蒲人懼，謂孔子曰：「苟毋適衛，吾出子。」

translations.literal: Pu people feared, told Kong Zi said: 'If not go Wei, we let you out.'
translations.idiomatic: The Pu people feared and told Kong Zi: 'If you do not go to Wei, we will let you out.'

sentences.zh: 與之盟，出孔子東門。

translations.literal: They made a covenant with him and let Kong Zi out the east gate.

sentences.zh: 孔子遂適衛。

translations.literal: Kong Zi thus went to Wei.

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「盟可負耶？」

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: 'Covenant can break?'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Gong said: 'Can covenants be broken?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「要盟也，神不聽。」

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Forced covenant, spirits not listen.'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'It was a forced covenant. The spirits do not listen to it.'

translations.literal: Passing through Pu, encountered Gong Shu clan rebelling with Pu, Pu people stopped Confucius. Among disciples was Gong Liang Ru, who followed Confucius with five private chariots. His character was tall and worthy, with courage and strength, he said: 'I once followed master and encountered difficulty at Kuang, now encounter difficulty here again, it is fate. I and master have suffered difficulty twice, would rather fight and die.' He fought very fiercely. Pu people feared, told Confucius: 'If you do not go to Wei, we will release you.' Made covenant with them, released Confucius out the east gate. Confucius thus went to Wei. Zi Gong said: 'Can covenants be broken?' Confucius said: 'It was a forced covenant, the spirits do not accept it.'

sentences.zh: 衛靈公聞孔子來，喜，郊迎。

translations.literal: Wei Ling Gong heard Kong Zi was coming, was pleased, and welcomed him in the suburbs.

sentences.zh: 問曰：「蒲可伐乎？」

translations.literal: Asked said: 'Pu can attack?'
translations.idiomatic: He asked: 'Can Pu be attacked?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「可。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Can.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'It can.'

sentences.zh: 靈公曰：「吾大夫以為不可。

translations.literal: Ling Gong said: 'My grand masters think not possible.
translations.idiomatic: Ling Gong said: 'My grand masters think it is not possible.'

sentences.zh: 今蒲，衛之所以待晉楚也，以衛伐之，無乃不可乎？」

translations.literal: Now Pu, Wei what waits Jin Chu, with Wei attack it, perhaps not possible?'
translations.idiomatic: Now Pu is what Wei uses to wait upon Jin and Chu. To attack it with Wei - is it not perhaps impossible?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「其男子有死之志，婦人有保西河之志。

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Their men have die determination, women have guard west river determination.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Their men have the determination to die. Their women have the determination to guard the west river.'

sentences.zh: 吾所伐者不過四五人。」

translations.literal: What I attack not exceed four five people.'
translations.idiomatic: What I would attack would not exceed four or five people.'

sentences.zh: 靈公曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Ling Gong said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 然不伐蒲。

translations.literal: However, he did not attack Pu.

Wei Ling Gong heard Confucius was coming, was pleased, welcomed him at the suburbs. Asked: 'Can Pu be attacked?' Replied: 'It can.' Ling Gong said: 'My ministers think it cannot. Now Pu is what Wei uses to deal with Jin and Chu, to attack it with Wei, is it not impossible?' Confucius said: 'Its men have the will to die, its women have the will to defend the west river. Those I would attack are no more than four or five people.' Ling Gong said: 'Good.' Yet did not attack Pu.

sentences.zh: 靈公老，怠於政，不用孔子。

translations.literal: Ling Gong was old and negligent in government. He did not employ Kong Zi.

sentences.zh: 孔子喟然歎曰：「苟有用我者，朞月而已，三年有成。」

translations.literal: Kong Zi sighed deeply said: 'If those who use me, one year already, three years have achievement.'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi sighed deeply and said: 'If there were those who would use me, in one year there would be results, and in three years there would be achievement.'

sentences.zh: 孔子行。

translations.literal: Kong Zi departed.

Ling Gong was old, neglected government affairs, did not employ Confucius. Confucius sighed deeply: 'If someone would employ me, in one month there would be results, in three years achievement.' Confucius departed.

sentences.zh: 佛肸為中牟宰。

translations.literal: Bi Xi was governor of Zhong Mou.

sentences.zh: 趙簡子攻范、中行，伐中牟。

translations.literal: Zhao Jian Zi attacked the Fan and Zhong Hang clans and attacked Zhong Mou.

sentences.zh: 佛肸畔，使人召孔子。

translations.literal: Bi Xi rebelled and sent someone to summon Kong Zi.

sentences.zh: 孔子欲往。

translations.literal: Kong Zi wanted to go.

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「由聞諸夫子，『其身親為不善者，君子不入也』。

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'You heard from master, 'Those who personally do not good, gentlemen not enter.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu said: 'You heard from the master that 'gentlemen do not enter where those who personally do evil are.'

sentences.zh: 今佛肸親以中牟畔，子欲往，如之何？」

translations.literal: Now Bi Xi personally with Zhong Mou rebelled, master want go, how?'
translations.idiomatic: Now Bi Xi has personally rebelled with Zhong Mou. Master wants to go - how is this?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「有是言也。

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'There is this saying.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'There is this saying.'

sentences.zh: 不曰堅乎，磨而不磷；

translations.literal: Not said firm, grind not thin;
translations.idiomatic: Is it not said to be firm? Ground but not thinned.

sentences.zh: 不曰白乎，涅而不淄。

translations.literal: Is it not said to be white? Dyed but not blackened.'

sentences.zh: 我豈匏瓜也哉，焉能系而不食？」

translations.literal: I how bottle gourd, how can hang not eat?'
translations.idiomatic: Am I a bottle gourd? How can I be hung without being eaten?'

translations.literal: Fo Xi was magistrate of Zhongmu. Zhao Jian Zi attacked Fan and Zhong Xing, attacked Zhongmu. Fo Xi rebelled, sent someone to summon Confucius. Confucius wished to go. Zi Lu said: 'I heard from the master, "Gentlemen do not enter where those who personally do evil are." Now Fo Xi personally rebels with Zhongmu, master wishes to go, how is this?' Confucius said: 'There are these words. Does it not say firm, ground but not worn; does it not say white, dyed but not blackened. Am I a bitter gourd, how can I hang without being eaten?'

sentences.zh: 孔子擊磬。

translations.literal: Kong Zi struck the chime.

sentences.zh: 有荷蕢而過門者，曰：「有心哉，擊磬乎！

translations.literal: Had carry hoe pass gate, said: 'Have heart, strike chime!
translations.idiomatic: There was one carrying a hoe who passed the gate and said: 'He has heart, striking the chime!'

sentences.zh: 硜硜乎，莫己知也夫而已矣！」

translations.literal: Clanging, none know self, just that!'
translations.idiomatic: Clanging - none know himself, just that!'

translations.literal: Confucius played the chime. Someone carrying a hoe passed the gate, said: 'There is purpose here, playing the chime! Clang clang, none know me, that's all!'

sentences.zh: 孔子學鼓琴師襄子，十日不進。

translations.literal: Kong Zi studied playing the zither with Teacher Xiang Zi. For ten days he did not advance.

sentences.zh: 師襄子曰：「可以益矣。」

translations.literal: Teacher Xiang Zi said: 'Can add.'
translations.idiomatic: Teacher Xiang Zi said: 'You can add to it.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「丘已習其曲矣，未得其數也。」

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Qiu already practiced its melody, not obtained its technique.'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Qiu has already practiced its melody but has not obtained its technique.'

sentences.zh: 有間，曰：「已習其數，可以益矣。」

translations.literal: After interval, said: 'Already practiced its technique, can add.'
translations.idiomatic: After an interval, he said: 'You have already practiced its technique. You can add to it.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「丘未得其志也。」

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Qiu not obtained its intent.'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Qiu has not obtained its intent.'

sentences.zh: 有間，曰：「已習其志，可以益矣。」

translations.literal: After interval, said: 'Already practiced its intent, can add.'
translations.idiomatic: After an interval, he said: 'You have already practiced its intent. You can add to it.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「丘未得其為人也。」

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Qiu not obtained its person.'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Qiu has not obtained its person.'

sentences.zh: 有間，［曰］有所穆然深思焉，有所怡然高望而遠志焉。

translations.literal: After an interval, he became solemn in deep thought there, and joyful in high gaze with far ambition there.

sentences.zh: 曰：「丘得其為人，黯然而黑，幾然而長，眼如望羊，如王四國，非文王其誰能為此也！」

translations.literal: Said: 'Qiu obtained its person, dark black, tall long, eyes like gazing sheep, like king four states, not Wen Wang who could do this!'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Qiu has obtained its person - dark and black, tall and long, eyes like gazing at sheep, like a king of the four states. Who but Wen Wang could do this!'

sentences.zh: 師襄子辟席再拜，曰：「師蓋云文王操也。」

translations.literal: Teacher Xiang Zi avoided seat bowed twice, said: 'Teacher probably said Wen Wang piece.'
translations.idiomatic: Teacher Xiang Zi avoided his seat and bowed twice, saying: 'The teacher probably said it was Wen Wang's piece.'

translations.literal: Confucius studied playing the lute with Master Xiang Zi, ten days without progressing. Master Xiang Zi said: 'You can add to it.' Confucius said: 'I have practiced the melody, but have not gotten its rhythm.' After a while, said: 'Have practiced the rhythm, you can add to it.' Confucius said: 'I have not gotten its intent.' After a while, said: 'Have gotten the intent, you can add to it.' Confucius said: 'I have not gotten the person.' After a while, there was something solemn and deep in thought, something cheerful and gazing high with far-reaching ambition. Said: 'I have gotten the person, dark and black, tall and long, eyes like gazing sheep, like ruling the four directions, who but King Wen could do this!' Master Xiang Zi moved his mat and bowed twice, said: 'The master indeed said it is King Wen's piece.'

sentences.zh: 孔子既不得用於衛，將西見趙簡子。

translations.literal: Kong Zi was already not employed in Wei and was about to go west to see Zhao Jian Zi.

sentences.zh: 至於河而聞竇鳴犢、舜華之死也，臨河而嘆曰：「美哉水，洋洋乎！

translations.literal: Arrived at river heard Dou Ming Du, Shun Hua death, faced river sighed said: 'Beautiful water, vast!
translations.idiomatic: He arrived at the river and heard of the deaths of Dou Ming Du and Shun Hua. Facing the river he sighed and said: 'Beautiful is the water, so vast!'

sentences.zh: 丘之不濟此，命也夫！」

translations.literal: Qiu not cross this, fate!'
translations.idiomatic: Qiu cannot cross this - it is fate!'

sentences.zh: 子貢趨而進曰：「敢問何謂也？」

translations.literal: Zi Gong hurried advanced said: 'Dare ask what mean?'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Gong hurried forward and said: 'Dare I ask what this means?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「竇鳴犢，舜華，晉國之賢大夫也。

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Dou Ming Du, Shun Hua, Jin state worthy grand masters.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Dou Ming Du and Shun Hua were worthy grand masters of Jin state.'

sentences.zh: 趙簡子未得志之時，須此兩人而后從政；

translations.literal: Zhao Jian Zi not obtain ambition time, needed these two people then from government;
translations.idiomatic: When Zhao Jian Zi had not obtained his ambitions, he needed these two people before he could engage in government.

sentences.zh: 及其已得志，殺之乃從政。

translations.literal: When he had already obtained his ambitions, he killed them and then engaged in government.'

sentences.zh: 丘聞之也：刳胎殺夭，則麒麟不至郊；

translations.literal: Qiu heard: 'Cut fetus kill young, then qilin not come suburbs;
translations.idiomatic: Qiu has heard: 'If you cut fetuses and kill the young, then qilin will not come to the suburbs.'

sentences.zh: 竭澤涸漁，則蛟龍不合陰陽；

translations.literal: Exhaust marsh dry fish, then flood dragons not unite yin yang;
translations.idiomatic: If you exhaust the marshes and dry out the fish, then flood dragons will not unite yin and yang.'

sentences.zh: 覆巢毀卵，則鳳皇不翔。

translations.literal: If you overturn nests and destroy eggs, then phoenixes will not soar.'

sentences.zh: 何則？

translations.literal: Why?

sentences.zh: 君子諱傷其類也。

translations.literal: Gentlemen avoid harming their own kind.'

sentences.zh: 夫鳥獸之於不義也尚知辟之，而況乎丘哉！」

translations.literal: Birds beasts at injustice still know avoid it, moreover Qiu!'
translations.idiomatic: Even birds and beasts still know to avoid injustice - moreover for Qiu!'

sentences.zh: 乃還息乎陬鄉，作為陬操以哀之。

translations.literal: Thus he returned and rested in Zou xiang, composing the Zou piece to mourn them.

sentences.zh: 而反乎衛，入主蘧伯玉家。

translations.literal: Then he returned to Wei and entered to lodge at Qu Bo Yu's home.

Confucius having been unable to be employed in Wei, was about to go west to see Zhao Jian Zi. Reached the river and heard of Dou Ming Du and Shun Hua's deaths, by the river sighed: 'Beautiful indeed water, vast! My not crossing this, it is fate!'
