Zi Gong hurried forward: 'May I ask what this means?' Confucius said: 'Dou Ming Du, Shun Hua, Jin's worthy ministers. When Zhao Jian Zi had not yet achieved his ambitions, he depended on these two men then conducted affairs; when he had achieved his ambitions, killed them then conducted affairs. I have heard: cut open fetuses and kill the young, then qilin do not come to the suburbs; drain ponds and dry up fisheries, then dragons do not harmonize yin and yang; overturn nests and destroy eggs, then phoenixes do not soar. Why is this?' Gentlemen avoid harming their kind. Even birds and beasts know to avoid injustice, how much more so I! Thus returned and rested in Zou village, composed the Zou melody to mourn him. Then returned to Wei, entered and stayed at Qu Bo Yu's home.

sentences.zh: 他日，靈公問兵陳。

translations.literal: Another day, Ling Gong asked about troop formations.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「俎豆之事則嘗聞之，軍旅之事未之學也。」

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Zu dou matters then once heard them, military matters not studied.'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'As for zu dou matters, I have once heard of them. Military matters I have not studied.'

sentences.zh: 明日，與孔子語，見蜚鴈，仰視之，色不在孔子。

translations.literal: The next day, he spoke with Kong Zi. He saw flying geese, gazed up at them, and his attention was not on Kong Zi.

sentences.zh: 孔子遂行，復如陳。

translations.literal: Kong Zi thus departed and again went to Chen.

Another day, Ling Gong asked about military formations. Confucius said: 'Ritual matters I have heard of, military matters I have not studied.' The next day, spoke with Confucius, saw flying geese, gazed up at them, his color was not on Confucius. Confucius thus departed, returned to Chen.

sentences.zh: 夏，衛靈公卒，立孫輒，是為衛出公。

translations.literal: Summer, Wei Ling Gong died. They established his grandson Zhe, who became Wei Chu Gong.

sentences.zh: 六月，趙鞅內太子蒯聵于戚。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Zhao Yang brought Crown Prince Kuai Kui into Qi.

sentences.zh: 陽虎使太子絻，八人衰絰，偽自衛迎者，哭而入，遂居焉。

translations.literal: Yang Hu made the Crown Prince wear mourning. Eight people in mourning garments with mourning bands, falsely as welcomers from Wei, cried and entered, and thus dwelt there.

sentences.zh: 冬，蔡遷于州來。

translations.literal: Winter, Cai moved to Zhou Lai.

sentences.zh: 是歲魯哀公三年，而孔子年六十矣。

translations.literal: This year was Lu Ai Gong's third year, and Kong Zi was already sixty years old.

sentences.zh: 齊助衛圍戚，以衛太子蒯聵在故也。

translations.literal: Qi assisted Wei in besieging Qi, because the Wei Crown Prince Kuai Kui was there.

Summer, Wei Ling Gong died, established grandson Jie, who became Wei Chu Gong. Sixth month, Zhao Yang brought crown prince Kuai Kui inside Qi. Yang Hu made the crown prince wear mourning clothes, eight people in mourning attire, falsely as those welcoming from Wei, crying as they entered, thus resided there. Winter, Cai moved to Zhou Lai. This year was Lu Ai Gong's third year, Confucius was sixty years old. Qi helped Wei besiege Qi because crown prince Kuai Kui was there.

sentences.zh: 夏，魯桓釐廟燔，南宮敬叔救火。

translations.literal: Summer, the Lu Huan Xi temple burned, and Nan Gong Jing Shu saved it from the fire.

sentences.zh: 孔子在陳，聞之，曰：「災必於桓釐廟乎？」

translations.literal: Kong Zi in Chen, heard it, said: 'Disaster must at Huan Xi temple?'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi was in Chen. He heard of it and said: 'The disaster must be at the Huan Xi temple?'

sentences.zh: 已而果然。

translations.literal: Afterwards it was indeed so.
Summer, Lu Huan Xi temple burned, Nan Gong Jing Shu saved the fire. Confucius in Chen heard of it, said: 'The disaster must be at Huan Xi temple?' Soon indeed so.

sentences.zh: 秋，季桓子病，輦而見魯城，喟然嘆曰：「昔此國幾興矣，以吾獲罪於孔子，故不興也。」

translations.literal: Autumn, Ji Huan Zi ill, carried saw Lu city, sighed deeply said: 'Formerly this state almost prospered, because I offended Kong Zi, thus not prosper.'
translations.idiomatic: Autumn, Ji Huan Zi was ill. He was carried to see Lu city and sighed deeply, saying: 'Formerly this state almost prospered. Because I offended Kong Zi, it thus did not prosper.'

sentences.zh: 顧謂其嗣康子曰：「我即死，若必相魯；

translations.literal: Looked back told his successor Kang Zi said: 'I then die, you must chancellor Lu;
translations.idiomatic: He looked back and told his successor Kang Zi, saying: 'When I die, you must be chancellor of Lu.'

sentences.zh: 相魯，必召仲尼。」

translations.literal: Chancellor Lu, must summon Zhong Ni.'
translations.idiomatic: Be chancellor of Lu, and you must summon Zhong Ni.'

sentences.zh: 後數日，桓子卒，康子代立。

translations.literal: After several days, Huan Zi died and Kang Zi succeeded and was established.

sentences.zh: 已葬，欲召仲尼。

translations.literal: After the burial, he wanted to summon Zhong Ni.

sentences.zh: 公之魚曰：「昔吾先君用之不終，終為諸侯笑。

translations.literal: Gong Zhi Yu said: 'Formerly our former lord employed him not to end, finally became feudal lords laughter.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhi Yu said: 'Formerly our former lord employed him but did not finish, and finally became the laughter of the feudal lords.'

sentences.zh: 今又用之，不能終，是再為諸侯笑。」

translations.literal: Now again employ him, cannot finish, is again become feudal lords laughter.'
translations.idiomatic: Now if we employ him again and cannot finish, we will again become the laughter of the feudal lords.'

sentences.zh: 康子曰：「則誰召而可？」

translations.literal: Kang Zi said: 'Then who summon acceptable?'
translations.idiomatic: Kang Zi said: 'Then whom should we summon that would be acceptable?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「必召冉求。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Must summon Ran Qiu.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'You must summon Ran Qiu.'

sentences.zh: 於是使使召冉求。

translations.literal: Thus he sent an envoy to summon Ran Qiu.

sentences.zh: 冉求將行，孔子曰：「魯人召求，非小用之，將大用之也。」

translations.literal: Ran Qiu about to go, Kong Zi said: 'Lu people summon Qiu, not small use him, will greatly use him.'
translations.idiomatic: Ran Qiu was about to go. Kong Zi said: 'The Lu people are summoning Qiu. They will not use him in a small way - they will use him greatly.'

sentences.zh: 是日，孔子曰：「歸乎歸乎！

translations.literal: This day, Kong Zi said: 'Return! Return!
translations.idiomatic: This day, Kong Zi said: 'Let us return! Let us return!'

sentences.zh: 吾黨之小子狂簡，斐然成章，吾不知所以裁之。」

translations.literal: My party youths mad simple, patterned become chapter, I not know how regulate them.'
translations.idiomatic: The youths of my party are madly simple. Patterned, they become chapters. I do not know how to regulate them.'

sentences.zh: 子貢知孔子思歸，送冉求，因誡曰「即用，以孔子為招」云。

translations.literal: Zi Gong knew Kong Zi thought of returning, sent off Ran Qiu, thus admonished said 'when employ, use Kong Zi as lure' etc.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Gong knew Kong Zi was thinking of returning. He sent off Ran Qiu and thus admonished him, saying 'when you are employed, use Kong Zi as the lure,' etc.

translations.literal: Autumn, Ji Huan Zi fell ill and was carried to view Lu's city walls. He sighed deeply, saying: 'In the past this state was nearly prosperous, but because I offended Confucius, it did not prosper.' Looking back at his heir Kang Zi said: 'I will die soon, you must govern Lu; governing Lu, must summon Zhong Ni.' After several days, Huan Zi died, Kang Zi succeeded. After burial, wished to summon Zhong Ni. Gong Yu Yu said: 'In the past our former lord employed him but not to the end, finally became the laughingstock of the feudal lords. Now employing him again, if cannot finish, this is again becoming the laughingstock of the feudal lords.' Kang Zi said: 'Then who can be summoned?' Said: 'Must summon Ran Qiu.' Thus sent envoys to summon Ran Qiu. Ran Qiu about to go, Confucius said: 'Lu people summon Qiu, not for small use, will greatly use him.' That day, Confucius said: 'Return home! Return home! My party's youths are ardent and simple, their patterns are brilliant, I do not know how to cut them.' Zi Gong knew Confucius wished to return, sent Ran Qiu, admonishing to 'if employed, use Confucius as the banner.'

sentences.zh: 冉求既去，明年，孔子自陳遷于蔡。

translations.literal: Ran Qiu had already left. The next year, Kong Zi moved from Chen to Cai.

sentences.zh: 蔡昭公將如吳，吳召之也。

translations.literal: Cai Zhao Gong was about to go to Wu - Wu had summoned him.

sentences.zh: 前昭公欺其臣遷州來，後將往，大夫懼復遷，公孫翩射殺昭公。

translations.literal: The former Zhao Gong deceived his ministers and moved to Zhou Lai. Later he was about to go, but the grand masters feared he would move again, so Gong Sun Pian shot and killed Zhao Gong.

sentences.zh: 楚侵蔡。

translations.literal: Chu invaded Cai.

sentences.zh: 秋，齊景公卒。

translations.literal: Autumn, Qi Jing Gong died.

Ran Qiu having left, next year, Confucius from Chen moved to Cai. Cai Zhao Gong about to go to Wu, Wu summoned him. Previously Zhao Gong deceived his ministers to move Zhou Lai, now about to go, ministers feared he would move again, Gong Sun Pian shot and killed Zhao Gong. Chu invaded Cai. Autumn, Qi Jing Gong died.

sentences.zh: 明年，孔子自蔡如葉。

translations.literal: The next year, Kong Zi went from Cai to Ye.

sentences.zh: 葉公問政，孔子曰：「政在來遠附邇。」

translations.literal: Ye Gong asked government, Kong Zi said: 'Government in bring far attach near.'
translations.idiomatic: Ye Gong asked about government. Kong Zi said: 'Government lies in bringing the far and attaching the near.'

sentences.zh: 他日，葉公問孔子於子路，子路不對。

translations.literal: Another day, Ye Gong asked about Kong Zi to Zi Lu, but Zi Lu did not respond.

sentences.zh: 孔子聞之，曰：「由，爾何不對曰『其為人也，學道不倦，誨人不厭，發憤忘食，樂以忘憂，不知老之將至』云爾。」

translations.literal: Kong Zi heard it, said: 'You, why not respond said 'his person, study way not tired, teach people not weary, exert forget eat, joy forget worry, not know old approaching' etc.'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi heard it and said: 'You - why did you not respond, saying "his person studies the way without tiring, teaches people without wearying, exerts himself and forgets to eat, finds joy and forgets worry, does not know that old age is approaching," etc.'

translations.literal: Next year, Confucius from Cai went to Ye. Ye Gong asked about governance, Confucius said: 'Governance lies in attracting the distant and attaching the near.' Another day, Ye Gong asked Confucius to Zi Lu, Zi Lu did not answer. Confucius heard of it, said: 'You, why not answer saying "His character is: studies the Way without tiring, teaches others without wearying, becomes indignant and forgets food, joyful and forgets worry, does not know old age is approaching" thus.'

sentences.zh: 去葉，反于蔡。

translations.literal: He left Ye and returned to Cai.

sentences.zh: 長沮、桀溺耦而耕，孔子以為隱者，使子路問津焉。

translations.literal: Chang Ju and Jie Ni were yoked and plowing. Kong Zi thought they were hidden ones and made Zi Lu ask about the ford there.

sentences.zh: 長沮曰：「彼執輿者為誰？」

translations.literal: Chang Ju said: 'That holding reins one who?'
translations.idiomatic: Chang Ju said: 'Who is that one holding the reins?'

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「為孔丘。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Kong Qiu.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「是魯孔丘與？」

translations.literal: Said: 'Is Lu Kong Qiu?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Is it Lu's Kong Qiu?'

translations.literal: Said: 'Yes.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「是知津矣。」

translations.literal: Said: 'This knows ford already.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'This one already knows the ford.'

sentences.zh: 桀溺謂子路曰：「子為誰？」

translations.literal: Jie Ni told Zi Lu said: 'You who?'
translations.idiomatic: Jie Ni told Zi Lu: 'Who are you?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「為仲由。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Zhong You.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Zhong You.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「子，孔丘之徒與？」

translations.literal: Said: 'You, Kong Qiu follower?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Are you Kong Qiu's follower?'

translations.literal: Said: 'Yes.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 桀溺曰：「悠悠者天下皆是也，而誰以易之？

translations.literal: Jie Ni said: 'Leisurely ones world all is, yet who with change it?
translations.idiomatic: Jie Ni said: 'The leisurely ones - the world is full of them. Yet who can change it?'

sentences.zh: 且與其從辟人之士，豈若從辟世之士哉！」

translations.literal: Moreover with follow avoid people scholars, how if follow avoid world scholars!'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, rather than following scholars who avoid people, how about following scholars who avoid the world!'

sentences.zh: 耰而不輟。

translations.literal: They harrowed without stopping.

sentences.zh: 子路以告孔子，孔子憮然曰：「鳥獸不可與同群。

translations.literal: Zi Lu with told Kong Zi, Kong Zi disappointed said: 'Birds beasts cannot with same flock.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu told Kong Zi about it. Kong Zi said disappointedly: 'One cannot flock together with birds and beasts.'

sentences.zh: 天下有道，丘不與易也。」

translations.literal: World has way, Qiu not with change it.'
translations.idiomatic: If the world had the way, Qiu would not change it.'

translations.literal: Left Ye, returned to Cai. Chang Ju and Jie Ni were plowing together, Confucius considered them recluses, sent Zi Lu to ask for directions. Chang Ju said: 'That one holding the reins, who is he?' Zi Lu said: 'Kong Qiu.' Said: 'Is he Lu Kong Qiu?' Said: 'Yes.' Said: 'He knows the directions.' Jie Ni told Zi Lu: 'Who are you?' Said: 'Zhong You.' Said: 'Are you Kong Qiu's disciple?' Said: 'Yes.' Jie Ni said: 'The whole world is flooded, who can change it? Rather than follow those who avoid certain people, better to follow those who avoid the world!' Planted his hoe and would not speak. Zi Lu returned and told Confucius, Confucius sadly said: 'One cannot herd with birds and beasts. If the world has the Way, I will not change it.'

sentences.zh: 他日，子路行，遇荷蓧丈人，曰：「子見夫子乎？」

translations.literal: Another day, Zi Lu walked, met carrying hoe old man, said: 'You seen master?'
translations.idiomatic: Another day, Zi Lu was walking and met an old man carrying a hoe. He said: 'Have you seen the master?'

sentences.zh: 丈人曰：「四體不勤，五穀不分，孰為夫子！」

translations.literal: Old man said: 'Four limbs not diligent, five grains not distinguish, who master!'
translations.idiomatic: The old man said: 'One whose four limbs are not diligent and who does not distinguish the five grains - who is that master!'

sentences.zh: 植其杖而芸。

translations.literal: He planted his staff and hoed.

sentences.zh: 子路以告，孔子曰：「隱者也。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu with told, Kong Zi said: 'Hidden one.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu told Kong Zi about it. Kong Zi said: 'A hidden one.'

sentences.zh: 復往，則亡。

translations.literal: He went again, but he was gone.

Another day, Zi Lu was walking, encountered an old man carrying a hoe, said: 'Have you seen my master?' The old man said: 'Your four limbs are not diligent, five grains not distinguished, who is your master!' Planted his staff and weeded. Zi Lu returned and told Confucius, Confucius said: 'A recluse.' Went back again, but he had left.

sentences.zh: 孔子遷于蔡三歲，吳伐陳。

translations.literal: Kong Zi had moved to Cai for three years when Wu attacked Chen.

sentences.zh: 楚救陳，軍于城父。

translations.literal: Chu rescued Chen and stationed their army at Cheng Fu.

sentences.zh: 聞孔子在陳蔡之間，楚使人聘孔子。

translations.literal: They heard Kong Zi was between Chen and Cai, so Chu sent someone to invite Kong Zi.

sentences.zh: 孔子將往拜禮，陳蔡大夫謀曰：「孔子賢者，所刺譏皆中諸侯之疾。

translations.literal: Kong Zi about to go pay respects, Chen Cai grand masters plotted said: 'Kong Zi worthy one, his criticisms all hit feudal lords illnesses.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi was about to go and pay respects. The Chen and Cai grand masters plotted, saying: 'Kong Zi is a worthy one. His criticisms all hit the feudal lords' illnesses.'

sentences.zh: 今者久留陳蔡之間，諸大夫所設行皆非仲尼之意。

translations.literal: He has now long stayed between Chen and Cai. All the conduct established by the various grand masters is not Zhong Ni's intention.'

sentences.zh: 今楚，大國也，來聘孔子。

translations.literal: Now Chu is a great state and has come to invite Kong Zi.'

sentences.zh: 孔子用於楚，則陳蔡用事大夫危矣。」

translations.literal: Kong Zi employed in Chu, then Chen Cai governing grand masters in danger.'
translations.idiomatic: If Kong Zi is employed in Chu, then the governing grand masters of Chen and Cai will be in danger.'

sentences.zh: 於是乃相與發徒役圍孔子於野。

translations.literal: Thus they then together sent followers and laborers to surround Kong Zi in the wilds.

sentences.zh: 不得行，絕糧。

translations.literal: They could not go, and grain was cut off.

sentences.zh: 從者病，莫能興。

translations.literal: The followers were ill, and none could rise.

sentences.zh: 孔子講誦弦歌不衰。

translations.literal: Kong Zi lectured, recited, strummed, and sang without declining.

sentences.zh: 子路慍見曰：「君子亦有窮乎？」

translations.literal: Zi Lu angry appeared said: 'Gentleman also has poor?'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu appeared angrily and said: 'Do gentlemen also have times of poverty?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「君子固窮，小人窮斯濫矣。」

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Gentleman firmly poor, small person poor then overflow.'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'A gentleman is firm in poverty. A small person, when poor, overflows.'

translations.literal: Confucius stayed in Cai three years, Wu attacked Chen. Chu rescued Chen, camped at Cheng Fu. Heard Confucius was between Chen and Cai, Chu sent someone to invite Confucius. Confucius was about to go and perform the ritual visit, Chen and Cai ministers plotted: 'Confucius is worthy, his criticisms all hit the feudal lords' illnesses. Now he has stayed long between Chen and Cai, all the conduct set by the ministers is not according to Zhong Ni's intent. Now Chu is a great state, comes to invite Confucius. If Confucius is employed in Chu, then Chen and Cai's governing ministers will be in danger.' Thus together raised laborers and surrounded Confucius in the wilds. Could not proceed, cut off provisions. Followers were ill, none could rise. Confucius lectured and recited, played strings and sang without decline. Zi Lu indignantly appeared, said: 'Do gentlemen also have poverty?' Confucius said: 'Gentlemen are indeed poor, petty men when poor then become unruly.'

sentences.zh: 子貢色作。

translations.literal: Zi Gong's color changed.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「賜，爾以予為多學而識之者與？」

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Ci, you think me much study remember it ones?'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Ci, do you think I am one who studies much and remembers it?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「然。

translations.literal: Said: 'Yes.
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 非與？」

translations.literal: Not?'
translations.idiomatic: Is it not?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「非也。

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Not.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'No.'

sentences.zh: 予一以貫之。」

translations.literal: I one with thread it.'
translations.idiomatic: I thread it with one.'

translations.literal: Zi Gong's color changed. Confucius said: 'Ci, do you take me for one who has learned much and knows it?' Said: 'Yes. Is it not so?' Confucius said: 'Not so. I unify it with one.'

sentences.zh: 孔子知弟子有慍心，乃召子路而問曰：「《詩》云『匪兕匪虎，率彼曠野』。

translations.literal: Kong Zi knew disciples had angry heart, thus summoned Zi Lu asked said: 'Poetry says 'not rhinoceros not tiger, lead that vast wilds'.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi knew his disciples had angry hearts. Thus he summoned Zi Lu and asked, saying: 'The Poetry says "not rhinoceros not tiger, lead to that vast wilds".'

sentences.zh: 吾道非邪？

translations.literal: My way not wrong?
translations.idiomatic: Is my way wrong?'

sentences.zh: 吾何為於此？」

translations.literal: I why here?'
translations.idiomatic: Why am I here?'

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「意者吾未仁邪？

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Perhaps I not benevolent?
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu said: 'Perhaps I am not benevolent?'

sentences.zh: 人之不我信也。

translations.literal: People do not trust me.'

sentences.zh: 意者吾未知邪？

translations.literal: Perhaps I not wise?
translations.idiomatic: Perhaps I am not wise?'

sentences.zh: 人之不我行也。」

translations.literal: People not follow me.'
translations.idiomatic: People do not follow me.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「有是乎！

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Is this!
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Is this so!'

sentences.zh: 由，譬使仁者而必信，安有伯夷、叔齊？

translations.literal: You, analogy if benevolent ones certainly trusted, how have Bo Yi, Shu Qi?
translations.idiomatic: You - if benevolent ones were certainly trusted, how would there be Bo Yi and Shu Qi?'

sentences.zh: 使知者而必行，安有王子比干？」

translations.literal: If wise ones certainly followed, how have Wang Zi Bi Gan?'
translations.idiomatic: If wise ones were certainly followed, how would there be Wang Zi Bi Gan?'

translations.literal: Confucius knew his disciples had resentful hearts, thus summoned Zi Lu and asked: 'The Poetry says "Not rhinoceros not tiger, following that wilderness". Is my Way not right? Why am I here?' Zi Lu said: 'Perhaps we are not yet benevolent? People do not trust me. Perhaps we do not yet know? People do not practice it.' Confucius said: 'There are these words! You, supposing benevolent people must be trusted, how would there be Bo Yi and Shu Qi? Supposing knowledgeable people must be practiced, how would there be Prince Bi Gan?'

sentences.zh: 子路出，子貢入見。

translations.literal: Zi Lu went out, and Zi Gong entered to see him.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「賜，《詩》云『匪兕匪虎，率彼曠野』。

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Ci, Poetry says 'not rhinoceros not tiger, lead that vast wilds'.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Ci, the Poetry says "not rhinoceros not tiger, lead to that vast wilds".'

sentences.zh: 吾道非邪？

translations.literal: My way not wrong?
translations.idiomatic: Is my way wrong?'

sentences.zh: 吾何為於此？」

translations.literal: I why here?'
translations.idiomatic: Why am I here?'

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「夫子之道至大也，故天下莫能容夫子。

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: 'Master way extremely great, thus world none can contain master.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Gong said: 'The master's way is extremely great, thus the world cannot contain the master.'

sentences.zh: 夫子蓋少貶焉？」

translations.literal: Master probably slightly lower?'
translations.idiomatic: The master should probably lower himself slightly?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「賜，良農能稼而不能為穡，良工能巧而不能為順。

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Ci, good farmer can sow cannot harvest, good craftsman can skillful cannot compliant.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Ci, a good farmer can sow but cannot harvest. A good craftsman can be skillful but cannot be compliant.'

sentences.zh: 君子能脩其道，綱而紀之，統而理之，而不能為容。

translations.literal: A gentleman can cultivate his way, outline and record it, unify and govern it, yet cannot be flexible.'

sentences.zh: 今爾不脩爾道而求為容。

translations.literal: Now you do not cultivate your way yet seek to be flexible.'

sentences.zh: 賜，而志不遠矣！」

translations.literal: Ci, your ambition not far!'
translations.idiomatic: Ci, your ambition is not far!'

translations.literal: Zi Lu went out, Zi Gong entered to see. Confucius said: 'Ci, the Poetry says "Not rhinoceros not tiger, following that wilderness". Is my Way not right? Why am I here?' Zi Gong said: 'The Master's Way is extremely great, therefore All Under Heaven cannot contain the Master. The Master should perhaps lower himself a bit?' Confucius said: 'Ci, good farmers can plant but cannot harvest, good craftsmen can be skillful but cannot be compliant. Gentlemen can cultivate their Way, outline and record it, unify and govern it, but cannot make accommodation. Now you do not cultivate your Way but seek accommodation. Ci, your ambitions are not far-reaching!'

sentences.zh: 子貢出，顏回入見。

translations.literal: Zi Gong went out, and Yan Hui entered to see him.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「回，《詩》云『匪兕匪虎，率彼曠野』。

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Hui, Poetry says 'not rhinoceros not tiger, lead that vast wilds'.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Hui, the Poetry says "not rhinoceros not tiger, lead to that vast wilds".'

sentences.zh: 吾道非邪？

translations.literal: My way not wrong?
translations.idiomatic: Is my way wrong?'

sentences.zh: 吾何為於此？」

translations.literal: I why here?'
translations.idiomatic: Why am I here?'

sentences.zh: 顏回曰：「夫子之道至大，故天下莫能容。

translations.literal: Yan Hui said: 'Master way extremely great, thus world none can contain.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Hui said: 'The master's way is extremely great, thus the world cannot contain it.'

sentences.zh: 雖然，夫子推而行之，不容何病，不容然後見君子！

translations.literal: Although, master promote practice it, not contain what harm, not contain then see gentleman!
translations.idiomatic: Although, if the master promotes and practices it, what harm if not contained? Only when not contained is the gentleman seen!'

sentences.zh: 夫道之不修也，是吾醜也。

translations.literal: If the way is not cultivated, this is my shame.'

sentences.zh: 夫道既已大修而不用，是有國者之醜也。

translations.literal: If the way has already been greatly cultivated yet not used, this is the shame of those who possess states.'

sentences.zh: 不容何病，不容然後見君子！」

translations.literal: Not contain what harm, not contain then see gentleman!'
translations.idiomatic: What harm if not contained? Only when not contained is the gentleman seen!'

sentences.zh: 孔子欣然而笑曰：「有是哉顏氏之子！

translations.literal: Kong Zi happily laughed said: 'There is this Yan clan son!
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi laughed happily and said: 'There is such a son of the Yan clan!'

sentences.zh: 使爾多財，吾為爾宰。」

translations.literal: If make you much wealth, I be your steward.'
translations.idiomatic: If I made you wealthy, I would be your steward.'

translations.literal: Zi Gong went out, Yan Hui entered to see. Confucius said: 'Hui, the Poetry says "Not rhinoceros not tiger, following that wilderness". Is my Way not right? Why am I here?' Yan Hui said: 'The Master's Way is extremely great, therefore All Under Heaven cannot contain it. Although this is so, the Master pushes forward and practices it, not being contained is no illness, not being contained then sees the gentleman! The Way not being cultivated is our shame. The Way having been greatly cultivated yet not employed is the shame of those who have states. Not being contained is no illness, not being contained then sees the gentleman!' Confucius smiled happily, said: 'There are such words, Yan family's son! If you had much wealth, I would be your steward.'

sentences.zh: 於是使子貢至楚。

translations.literal: Thus he sent Zi Gong to Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚昭王興師迎孔子，然後得免。

translations.literal: Chu Zhao Wang raised troops to welcome Kong Zi, and then he got to escape.
Thus sent Zi Gong to Chu. Chu Zhao Wang raised troops to welcome Confucius, then obtained release.

sentences.zh: 昭王將以書社地七百里封孔子。

translations.literal: Zhao Wang was about to enfeoff Kong Zi with seven hundred li of Shu She land.

sentences.zh: 楚令尹子西曰：「王之使使諸侯有如子貢者乎？」

translations.literal: Chu Ling Yin Zi Xi said: 'King envoys to feudal lords have like Zi Gong ones?'
translations.idiomatic: Chu's Ling Yin Zi Xi said: 'Does the king have envoys to the feudal lords like Zi Gong?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「無有。」

translations.literal: Said: 'None have.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'None have.'

sentences.zh: 「王之輔相有如顏回者乎？」

translations.literal: 'King assistants ministers have like Yan Hui ones?'
translations.idiomatic: 'Does the king have assistant ministers like Yan Hui?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「無有。」

translations.literal: Said: 'None have.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'None have.'

sentences.zh: 「王之將率有如子路者乎？」

translations.literal: 'King generals commanders have like Zi Lu ones?'
translations.idiomatic: 'Does the king have generals and commanders like Zi Lu?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「無有。」

translations.literal: Said: 'None have.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'None have.'

sentences.zh: 「王之官尹有如宰予者乎？」

translations.literal: 'King officials governors have like Zai Yu ones?'
translations.idiomatic: 'Does the king have officials and governors like Zai Yu?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「無有。」

translations.literal: Said: 'None have.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'None have.'

sentences.zh: 「且楚之祖封於周，號為子男五十里。

translations.literal: 'Moreover Chu ancestors enfeoffed by Zhou, titled Zi Nan fifty li.
translations.idiomatic: 'Moreover, Chu's ancestors were enfeoffed by Zhou with the title of Zi Nan and fifty li.'

sentences.zh: 今孔丘述三五之法，明周召之業，王若用之，則楚安得世世堂堂方數千里乎？

translations.literal: Now Kong Qiu relates Three Five laws, clarifies Zhou Zhao achievements, king if use him, then Chu how get generation generation grandly square several thousand li?
translations.idiomatic: Now Kong Qiu relates the laws of the Three and Five, clarifies the achievements of Zhou and Zhao. If the king uses him, how will Chu get to be grandly several thousand li square for generation after generation?'

sentences.zh: 夫文王在豐，武王在鎬，百里之君卒王天下。

translations.literal: Wen Wang was in Feng, Wu Wang in Hao. A lord of a hundred li finally became king of the world.'

sentences.zh: 今孔丘得據土壤，賢弟子為佐，非楚之福也。」

translations.literal: Now Kong Qiu gets to occupy soil land, worthy disciples as assistants, not Chu fortune.'
translations.idiomatic: Now if Kong Qiu gets to occupy the soil and land, with worthy disciples as assistants, it will not be Chu's fortune.'

sentences.zh: 昭王乃止。

translations.literal: Zhao Wang thus stopped.

sentences.zh: 其秋，楚昭王卒于城父。

translations.literal: That autumn, Chu Zhao Wang died at Cheng Fu.

Zhao Wang wished to enfeoff Confucius with seven hundred li of book land. Chu prime minister Zi Xi said: 'The king's envoys to feudal lords have ones like Zi Gong?' Said: 'None have.' 'The king's assistants and ministers have ones like Yan Hui?' Said: 'None have.' 'The king's generals have ones like Zi Lu?' Said: 'None have.' 'The king's officials have ones like Zai Yu?' Said: 'None have.' 'Moreover Chu's ancestors were enfeoffed by Zhou, numbered as zi and nan with fifty li. Now Kong Qiu expounds the laws of the Three and Five, clarifies Zhou and Shao's achievements, the king if employs him, then how can Chu generation after generation maintain its grandness of several thousand li? King Wen was in Feng, King Wu in Hao, lords of one hundred li ultimately became kings of All Under Heaven. Now if Kong Qiu obtains land, with worthy disciples as aides, it is not Chu's fortune.' Zhao Wang thus stopped. That autumn, Chu Zhao Wang died at Cheng Fu.

sentences.zh: 楚狂接輿歌而過孔子曰：「鳳兮！

translations.literal: Chu madman Jie Yu sang passed Kong Zi said: 'Phoenix!
translations.idiomatic: The Chu madman Jie Yu sang as he passed Kong Zi, saying: 'Phoenix!'

sentences.zh: 鳳兮！

translations.literal: Phoenix!
translations.idiomatic: Phoenix!'

sentences.zh: 何德之衰？

translations.literal: What virtue decline?
translations.idiomatic: How has virtue declined?'

sentences.zh: 往者不可諫兮，來者猶可追也！

translations.literal: Gone ones cannot admonish, coming ones still can pursue!
translations.idiomatic: The gone cannot be admonished, the coming can still be pursued!'

sentences.zh: 已而，已而！

translations.literal: Stop, stop!
translations.idiomatic: Stop, stop!'

sentences.zh: 今之從政者殆而！」

translations.literal: Now participate government ones dangerous!'
translations.idiomatic: Those who now participate in government are in danger!'

sentences.zh: 孔子下，欲與之言。

translations.literal: Kong Zi descended and wanted to speak with him.

sentences.zh: 趨而去，弗得與之言。

translations.literal: He hurried away, and Kong Zi did not get to speak with him.

The Chu madman Jie Yu sang as he passed Confucius, saying: 'Phoenix! Phoenix! Why has virtue declined? The past cannot be admonished, the future can still be pursued! Enough, enough! Those who govern today are in peril!' Confucius descended, wished to speak with him. He hurried away, could not speak with him.

sentences.zh: 於是孔子自楚反乎衛。

translations.literal: Thus Kong Zi returned from Chu to Wei.

sentences.zh: 是歲也，孔子年六十三，而魯哀公六年也。

translations.literal: This year, Kong Zi was sixty-three years old, and it was Lu Ai Gong's sixth year.
Thus Confucius from Chu returned to Wei. This year, Confucius was sixty-three, Lu Ai Gong's sixth year.

sentences.zh: 其明年，吳與魯會繒，徵百牢。

translations.literal: The next year, Wu and Lu met at Zeng, and Wu demanded a hundred penned sacrificial animals.

sentences.zh: 太宰嚭召季康子。

translations.literal: Grand steward Kui summoned Ji Kang Zi.

sentences.zh: 康子使子貢往，然後得已。

translations.literal: Kang Zi made Zi Gong go, and then they got to stop.
The next year, Wu and Lu met at Zong, demanded one hundred cattle. Grand Steward Kuai summoned Ji Kang Zi. Kang Zi sent Zi Gong to go, then was relieved.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「魯衛之政，兄弟也。」

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Lu Wei government, brothers.'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'Lu and Wei's government are like brothers.'

sentences.zh: 是時，衛君輒父不得立，在外，諸侯數以為讓。

translations.literal: At this time, Wei lord Zhe's father could not be established and was outside. The feudal lords repeatedly yielded to him.

sentences.zh: 而孔子弟子多仕於衛，衛君欲得孔子為政。

translations.literal: Kong Zi's disciples served many in Wei, and the Wei lord wanted Kong Zi to govern.

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「衛君待子而為政，子將奚先？」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Wei lord awaits master govern, master will what first?'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu said: 'The Wei lord awaits the master to govern. What will the master do first?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「必也正名乎！」

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Must rectify names!'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'One must rectify names!'

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「有是哉，子之迂也！

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Is this, master pedantic!
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu said: 'Is this so? The master is pedantic!'

sentences.zh: 何其正也？」

translations.literal: How correct?'
translations.idiomatic: How correct is he?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「野哉由也！

translations.literal: Kong Zi said: 'Rustic You!
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi said: 'How rustic you are, You!'

sentences.zh: 夫名不正則言不順，言不順則事不成，事不成則禮樂不興，禮樂不興則刑罰不中，刑罰不中則民無所錯手足矣。

translations.literal: If names are not correct then words are not proper. If words are not proper then affairs are not accomplished. If affairs are not accomplished then ritual and music do not flourish. If ritual and music do not flourish then punishments are not appropriate. If punishments are not appropriate then the people have nowhere to place their hands and feet.'

sentences.zh: 夫君子為之必可名，言之必可行。

translations.literal: The gentleman does what must be namable, speaks what must be doable.'

sentences.zh: 君子於其言，無所苟而已矣。」

translations.literal: Gentleman at his words, nothing careless just.'
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman is nothing but careful with his words.'

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Lu and Wei's governance are like brothers.' At this time, Wei lord Jie Fu could not be established, was outside, feudal lords frequently reproached for it. Confucius's disciples many served in Wei, Wei lord wished to get Confucius for governance. Zi Lu said: 'Wei lord awaits master for governance, what will master put first?' Confucius said: 'Certainly rectifying names!' Zi Lu said: 'Is there such a thing! Master's pedantry! How proper is it?' Confucius said: 'Rustic indeed are you! If names are not correct then speech is not orderly, speech not orderly then affairs are not accomplished, affairs not accomplished then ritual and music do not flourish, ritual and music not flourishing then punishments are not appropriate, punishments not appropriate then people have nowhere to put hand and foot. Gentlemen make it certainly nameable, speak it certainly practicable. Gentlemen regarding their words have nothing careless.'

sentences.zh: 其明年，冉有為季氏將師，與齊戰於郎，克之。

translations.literal: The next year, Ran You led troops for the Ji clan and fought with Qi at Lang, conquering them.

sentences.zh: 季康子曰：「子之於軍旅，學之乎？

translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi said: 'You at military affairs, learned them?
translations.idiomatic: Ji Kang Zi said: 'As for you and military affairs, did you learn them?'

sentences.zh: 性之乎？」

translations.literal: Natural?'
translations.idiomatic: Are they natural?'

sentences.zh: 冉有曰：「學之於孔子。」

translations.literal: Ran You said: 'Learned from Kong Zi.'
translations.idiomatic: Ran You said: 'I learned them from Kong Zi.'

sentences.zh: 季康子曰：「孔子何如人哉？」

translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi said: 'Kong Zi what kind person?'
translations.idiomatic: Ji Kang Zi said: 'What kind of person is Kong Zi?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「用之有名；

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Employ him has name;
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Employing him has a name.'

sentences.zh: 播之百姓，質諸鬼神而無憾。

translations.literal: Broadcast to the common people, tested by ghosts and spirits without regret.'

sentences.zh: 求之至於此道，雖累千社，夫子不利也。」

translations.literal: Seek him reach this way, though burden thousand altars, master not benefit.'
translations.idiomatic: If you seek him to reach this way, though burdened with a thousand altars, the master will not benefit.'

sentences.zh: 康子曰：「我欲召之，可乎？」

translations.literal: Kang Zi said: 'I want summon him, acceptable?'
translations.idiomatic: Kang Zi said: 'I want to summon him. Is it acceptable?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「欲召之，則毋以小人固之，則可矣。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Want summon him, then not with small people surround him, then acceptable.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'If you want to summon him, then do not surround him with small people, and it will be acceptable.'

sentences.zh: 而衛孔文子將攻太叔，問策於仲尼。

translations.literal: Wei Kong Wen Zi was about to attack Tai Shu and asked strategy from Zhong Ni.

sentences.zh: 仲尼辭不知，退而命載而行，曰：「鳥能擇木，木豈能擇鳥乎！」

translations.literal: Zhong Ni declined not know, withdrew ordered load carriage depart, said: 'Bird can choose tree, tree how choose bird!'
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Ni declined saying he did not know. He withdrew, ordered the carriage loaded, and departed, saying: 'A bird can choose a tree, but how can a tree choose a bird!'

sentences.zh: 文子固止。

translations.literal: Wen Zi firmly stopped him.

sentences.zh: 會季康子逐公華、公賓、公林，以幣迎孔子，孔子歸魯。

translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi expelled Gong Hua, Gong Bin, and Gong Lin. He welcomed Kong Zi with silks, and Kong Zi returned to Lu.

The next year, Ran You served as Ji family general, fought Qi at Lang, conquered them. Ji Kang Zi said: 'Regarding military affairs, did you learn it? Is it natural?' Ran You said: 'Learned it from Confucius.' Ji Kang Zi said: 'What kind of person is Confucius?' Replied: 'Employing him brings fame; broadcast to the people, tested against ghosts and spirits without regret. Seeking to the utmost this Way, though burdening a thousand altars, the Master would not take profit.' Kang Zi said: 'I wish to summon him, may I?' Replied: 'Wishing to summon him, then do not restrain him with petty men, then it can be.' Wei Kong Wen Zi was about to attack Tai Shu, asked strategy from Zhong Ni. Zhong Ni declined not knowing, retired and ordered to load the cart and depart, said: 'Birds can choose trees, how can trees choose birds!' Wen Zi firmly stopped him. Met Ji Kang Zi expel Gong Hua, Gong Bin, Gong Lin, with gifts welcomed Confucius, Confucius returned to Lu.

sentences.zh: 孔子之去魯凡十四歲而反乎魯。

translations.literal: Kong Zi had left Lu for altogether fourteen years and returned to Lu.
Confucius's departure from Lu was fourteen years in total when he returned to Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯哀公問政，對曰：「政在選臣。」

translations.literal: Lu Ai Gong asked government, replied said: 'Government in select ministers.'
translations.idiomatic: Lu Ai Gong asked about government. He replied: 'Government lies in selecting ministers.'

sentences.zh: 季康子問政，曰：「舉直錯諸枉，則枉者直。」

translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi asked government, said: 'Raise straight place among crooked, then crooked become straight.'
translations.idiomatic: Ji Kang Zi asked about government. He said: 'Raise the straight and place them among the crooked, then the crooked will become straight.'

sentences.zh: 康子患盜，孔子曰：「苟子之不欲，雖賞之不竊。」

translations.literal: Kang Zi worried thieves, Kong Zi said: 'If you not desire, though reward not steal.'
translations.idiomatic: Kang Zi was worried about thieves. Kong Zi said: 'If you do not desire it, though rewarded, they will not steal.'

sentences.zh: 然魯終不能用孔子，孔子亦不求仕。

translations.literal: However, Lu finally could not employ Kong Zi, and Kong Zi also did not seek office.

Lu Ai Gong asked about governance, replied: 'Governance lies in selecting ministers.' Ji Kang Zi asked about governance, said: 'Raise the straight and place over the crooked, then the crooked become straight.' Kang Zi worried about thieves, Confucius said: 'If you do not desire, though rewarding them they will not steal.' Yet Lu ultimately could not employ Confucius, Confucius also did not seek office.

sentences.zh: 孔子之時，周室微而禮樂廢，詩書缺。

translations.literal: In Kong Zi's time, the Zhou house was weak and ritual and music were abolished. Poetry and books were deficient.

sentences.zh: 追跡三代之禮，序書傳，上紀唐虞之際，下至秦繆，編次其事。

translations.literal: He traced the rituals of the three dynasties, ordered the book transmissions, above recording the Tang and Yu period, below to Qin Mu, editing and arranging their affairs.

sentences.zh: 曰：「夏禮吾能言之，杞不足徵也。

translations.literal: Said: 'Xia ritual I can speak of, Qi not sufficient verify.
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Xia ritual I can speak of, but Qi is not sufficient to verify it.'

sentences.zh: 殷禮吾能言之，宋不足徵也。

translations.literal: Yin ritual I can speak of, but Song is not sufficient to verify it.'

sentences.zh: 足，則吾能徵之矣。」

translations.literal: Sufficient, then I can verify it.'
translations.idiomatic: If sufficient, then I can verify it.'

sentences.zh: 觀殷夏所損益，曰：「後雖百世可知也，以一文一質。

translations.literal: Viewed Yin Xia additions subtractions, said: 'Later though hundred generations know, with one culture one substance.
translations.idiomatic: He viewed the additions and subtractions of Yin and Xia, saying: 'Though later for a hundred generations it can be known, with one culture and one substance.'

sentences.zh: 周監二代，郁郁乎文哉。

translations.literal: Zhou observed the two dynasties - how richly cultured!'

sentences.zh: 吾從周。」

translations.literal: I follow Zhou.'

sentences.zh: 故《書傳》、《禮記》自孔氏。

translations.literal: Therefore the Book Transmissions and Ritual Records are from the Kong clan.

In Confucius's time, Zhou house was weak and ritual music decayed, poetry and documents deficient. He traced the rituals of the three dynasties, ordered documents and commentaries, above recording from Tang Yu's time, below reaching Qin Mu, edited their affairs. Said: 'Xia rituals I can speak of, Qi is insufficient to verify. Yin rituals I can speak of, Song is insufficient to verify. Sufficient, then I can verify them.' Observed Yin and Xia additions and subtractions, said: 'Later though a hundred generations can be known, with one culture one plainness. Zhou monitored the two dynasties, flourishing with culture! I follow Zhou.' Therefore Book Commentaries, Ritual Records are from the Kong family.

sentences.zh: 孔子語魯大師：「樂其可知也。

translations.literal: Kong Zi spoke Lu grand music master: 'Music can be known.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi spoke to Lu's grand music master: 'Music can be known.'

sentences.zh: 始作翕如，縱之純如，皦如，繹如也，以成。」

translations.literal: Begin make harmonious, extend pure, bright, continuous to complete.'
translations.idiomatic: Begin by making it harmonious, extend it to be pure, bright, continuous - thus complete it.'

sentences.zh: 「吾自衛反魯，然後樂正，雅頌各得其所。」

translations.literal: 'I from Wei returned Lu, then music correct, ya song each got their place.'
translations.idiomatic: 'I returned from Wei to Lu, then music was corrected, and ya and song each got their proper place.'

translations.literal: Confucius told Lu Grand Master: 'Music can be known. Beginning harmonious like, extending pure like, clear like, continuous like, thus complete.' 'I from Wei returned to Lu, then music was corrected, Ya and Song each obtained their place.'

sentences.zh: 古者詩三千餘篇，及至孔子，去其重，取可施於禮義，上采契后稷，中述殷周之盛，至幽厲之缺，始於衽席，故曰「關雎之亂以為風始，鹿鳴為小雅始，文王為大雅始，清廟為頌始」。

translations.literal: Ancient poetry three thousand more pieces, reached Kong Zi, removed duplicates, took applicable to ritual righteousness, above gathered Xie Hou Ji, middle described Yin Zhou prosperity, to You Li decline, began from bed mat, thus said 'Guan Ju disorder as feng start, Lu Ming as xiao ya start, Wen Wang as da ya start, Qing Miao as song start'.
translations.idiomatic: Ancient poetry had over three thousand pieces. When it reached Kong Zi, he removed duplicates and took what was applicable to ritual and righteousness. Above he gathered Xie and Hou Ji, in the middle described the prosperity of Yin and Zhou, down to the decline of You and Li, beginning from the bed mat. Thus it is said: 'Guan Ju's disorder as the start of feng, Lu Ming as the start of xiao ya, Wen Wang as the start of da ya, Qing Miao as the start of song.'

sentences.zh: 三百五篇孔子皆弦歌之，以求合韶武雅頌之音。

translations.literal: Kong Zi strummed and sang all three hundred five pieces, to seek to unite the sounds of Shao, Wu, ya, and song.

sentences.zh: 禮樂自此可得而述，以備王道，成六藝。

translations.literal: Ritual and music from this can be obtained and related, to prepare the kingly way, completing the six arts.

Ancient poetry was over three thousand pieces, until Confucius, removed duplicates, took what could be applied to ritual and righteousness, above gathered from Xie and Hou Ji, middle described Yin Zhou's flourishing, to You Li's decline, beginning from bed curtains, thus said 'Guan Ju's disorder begins the feng, Lu Ming begins the little ya, Wen Wang begins the great ya, Qing Miao begins the song'. Three hundred five pieces Confucius all played on strings and sang, to seek harmony with Shao Wu ya song sounds. Ritual and music from this can be obtained and expounded, to prepare the kingly way, complete the six arts.

sentences.zh: 孔子晚而喜易，序彖、繫、象、說卦、文言。

translations.literal: Kong Zi in his later years delighted in the Yi, ordering the Tuan, Xi, Xiang, Shuo Gua, and Wen Yan.

sentences.zh: 讀易，韋編三絕。

translations.literal: When reading the Yi, the leather bindings broke three times.

sentences.zh: 曰：「假我數年，若是，我於易則彬彬矣。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Lend me several years, like this, I at Yi then refined.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Lend me several more years. Like this, I would be refined in the Yi.'

translations.literal: Confucius late and delighted in Yi, ordered the tuan, xi, xiang, shuo gua, wen yan. Read Yi, leather straps broke three times. Said: 'Grant me a few more years, thus I at Yi would be refined.'

sentences.zh: 孔子以詩書禮樂教，弟子蓋三千焉，身通六藝者七十有二人。

translations.literal: Kong Zi taught with poetry, books, ritual, and music. His disciples were probably three thousand, and those who personally mastered the six arts were seventy-two.

sentences.zh: 如顏濁鄒之徒，頗受業者甚眾。

translations.literal: Like Yan Zhuo Zou and his followers, those who quite received instruction were very numerous.

Confucius taught with poetry documents ritual music, disciples altogether three thousand, those proficient in six arts seventy-two persons. Like Yan Zhu Zou's group, those who received teaching were very many.

sentences.zh: 孔子以四教：文，行，忠，信。

translations.literal: Kong Zi with four teachings: culture, conduct, loyalty, trustworthiness.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi taught with four things: culture, conduct, loyalty, trustworthiness.

sentences.zh: 絕四：毋意，毋必，毋固，毋我。

translations.literal: Abstained four: no arbitrary, no certain, no stubborn, no self.
translations.idiomatic: He abstained from four things: no arbitrary action, no certainty, no stubbornness, no self.

sentences.zh: 所慎：齊，戰，疾。

translations.literal: What careful: fasting, battle, illness.
translations.idiomatic: What he was careful about: fasting, battle, illness.

sentences.zh: 子罕言利與命與仁。

translations.literal: The master rarely spoke of profit, fate, or benevolence.

sentences.zh: 不憤不啟，舉一隅不以三隅反，則弗復也。

translations.literal: If not angered, he did not enlighten. If raising one corner they did not respond with three corners, he did not repeat.

Confucius taught four things: culture, conduct, loyalty, faith. Abstained from four: no intention, no certainty, no rigidity, no selfishness. What careful: fasting, war, illness. Rarely spoke of profit and fate and benevolence. Not indignant not enlightened, lift one corner not using three corners reverse, then not repeat.

sentences.zh: 其於鄉黨，恂恂似不能言者。

translations.literal: In his village community, he was gentle and appeared unable to speak.

sentences.zh: 其於宗廟朝廷，辯辯言，唯謹爾。

translations.literal: In ancestral temples and courts, he spoke eloquently, but only carefully.

sentences.zh: 朝，與上大夫言，誾誾如也；

translations.literal: At court, when speaking with senior grand masters, he was respectful.

sentences.zh: 與下大夫言，侃侃如也。

translations.literal: When speaking with junior grand masters, he was straightforward.

In his village, cautious like unable to speak. In ancestral temples and courts, eloquent speech, only careful. At court, speaking with upper ministers, solemn like; speaking with lower ministers, upright like.

sentences.zh: 入公門，鞠躬如也；

translations.literal: When entering the duke's gate, he bowed.

sentences.zh: 趨進，翼如也。

translations.literal: When hurrying forward, he was like wings.

sentences.zh: 君召使儐，色勃如也。

translations.literal: When the lord summoned him to usher, his color was vigorous.

sentences.zh: 君命召，不俟駕行矣。

translations.literal: When the lord commanded and summoned, he did not wait for the harness but went.
Entering the duke's gate, bowing like; hurrying forward, winged like. Lord summoned to act as host, color stern like. Lord commanded summon, did not wait for harness departed.

sentences.zh: 魚餒，肉敗，割不正，不食。

translations.literal: If fish was stale, meat spoiled, or cuts not proper, he did not eat.

sentences.zh: 席不正，不坐。

translations.literal: If the mat was not proper, he did not sit.

sentences.zh: 食於有喪者之側，未嘗飽也。

translations.literal: When eating at the side of those in mourning, he never ate his fill.
Fish spoiled, meat rotten, cut not proper, not eat. Mat not proper, not sit. Eating at the side of mourners, never full.

sentences.zh: 是日哭，則不歌。

translations.literal: If he cried that day, he did not sing.

sentences.zh: 見齊衰、瞽者，雖童子必變。

translations.literal: When seeing those in mourning garments or blind persons, though a child, he certainly changed expression.
That day cried, then not sing. Seeing mourning garments, blind people, though children must change.

sentences.zh: 「三人行，必得我師。」

translations.literal: 'Three people walk, must get my teacher.'
translations.idiomatic: 'When three people walk, there must be my teacher among them.'

sentences.zh: 「德之不脩，學之不講，聞義不能徙，不善不能改，是吾憂也。」

translations.literal: 'Virtue not cultivate, learning not discuss, heard righteousness cannot move, not good cannot change, this my worry.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Virtue not cultivated, learning not discussed, heard righteousness cannot move to it, not good cannot change - this is my worry.'

sentences.zh: 使人歌，善，則使復之，然后和之。

translations.literal: If he made someone sing and it was good, he made them repeat it, then harmonized with it.

'Three walking, must get my teacher.' 'Virtue not cultivated, learning not lectured, hearing righteousness cannot move, not good cannot change, this is my worry.' Made people sing, good, then made repeat, then harmonized with it.

sentences.zh: 子不語：怪，力，亂，神。

translations.literal: Master not spoke: strange, strength, disorder, spirits.
translations.idiomatic: The master did not speak of: strange things, strength, disorder, spirits.

translations.literal: Did not speak of: strange, force, disorder, spirits.

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「夫子之文章，可得聞也。

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: 'Master culture writings, can obtain hear.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Gong said: 'The master's cultured writings can be heard.'

sentences.zh: 夫子言天道與性命，弗可得聞也已。」

translations.literal: Master spoke heaven way with life nature, cannot obtain hear already.'
translations.idiomatic: The master spoke of heaven's way and life's nature, but these cannot be heard.'

sentences.zh: 顏淵喟然嘆曰：「仰之彌高，鑽之彌堅。

translations.literal: Yan Yuan sighed deeply said: 'Gaze at him increasingly high, drill increasingly firm.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Yuan sighed deeply and said: 'The more I gaze at him, the higher he is. The more I drill into him, the firmer he is.'

sentences.zh: 瞻之在前，忽焉在後。

translations.literal: I look at him in front, suddenly he's in back.'

sentences.zh: 夫子循循然善誘人，博我以文，約我以禮，欲罷不能。

translations.literal: The master step by step is good at guiding people. He enriches me with culture, restrains me with ritual. I want to stop but cannot.'

sentences.zh: 既竭我才，如有所立，卓爾。

translations.literal: He has already exhausted my talent, as if something stands there, outstanding.'

sentences.zh: 雖欲從之，蔑由也已。」

translations.literal: Though want follow him, no way already.'
translations.idiomatic: Though I want to follow him, there is no way.'

sentences.zh: 達巷黨人［童子］曰：「大哉孔子，博學而無所成名。」

translations.literal: Da Xiang community person [child] said: 'Great Confucius, broadly learned yet nothing achieved fame.'
translations.idiomatic: A child from the Da Xiang community said: 'Great is Confucius! Broadly learned yet nothing has achieved fame for him.'

sentences.zh: 子聞之曰：「我何執？

translations.literal: Master heard it said: 'I what hold?
translations.idiomatic: The master heard it and said: 'What should I hold to?'

sentences.zh: 執御乎？

translations.literal: Hold driving?
translations.idiomatic: Hold to driving?'

sentences.zh: 執射乎？

translations.literal: Hold archery?
translations.idiomatic: Hold to archery?'

sentences.zh: 我執御矣。」

translations.literal: I hold driving.'
translations.idiomatic: I will hold to driving.'

sentences.zh: 牢曰：「子云『不試，故藝』。」

translations.literal: Lao said: 'Master said 'not tested, therefore arts'.'
translations.idiomatic: Lao said: 'The master said "not tested, therefore arts."'

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: 'The Master's culture can be heard. The Master speaking of heavenly way and human nature, cannot be heard.' Yan Yuan sighed deeply: 'Gaze up increasingly high, drill increasingly firm. Look ahead, suddenly behind. The Master step by step skillfully guides people, broadens me with culture, restrains me with ritual, wish to stop cannot. Having exhausted my talent, as if standing, outstanding. Though wish to follow, no way.' Da Xiang village child said: 'Great indeed Confucius, broadly learned yet has no accomplished name.' Heard it, said: 'What do I hold? Hold charioteering? Hold archery? I hold charioteering.' Lao said: 'Master said "not tested, thus arts".'

sentences.zh: 魯哀公十四年春，狩大野。

translations.literal: In Lu Ai Gong's fourteenth year, spring, he hunted in the great wilds.

sentences.zh: 叔孫氏車子鉏商獲獸，以為不祥。

translations.literal: The Shu Sun clan's charioteer Zi Chu Shang obtained a beast and thought it inauspicious.

sentences.zh: 仲尼視之，曰：「麟也。」

translations.literal: Zhong Ni looked at it, said: 'Qilin.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Ni looked at it and said: 'It is a qilin.'

sentences.zh: 取之。

translations.literal: They took it.

sentences.zh: 曰：「河不出圖，雒不出書，吾已矣夫！」

translations.literal: Said: 'River not produce diagram, Luo not produce writings, I ended!'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'The River does not produce the diagram, the Luo does not produce the writings. I am ended!'

sentences.zh: 顏淵死，孔子曰：「天喪予！」

translations.literal: Yan Yuan died, Kong Zi said: 'Heaven bereaves me!'
translations.idiomatic: When Yan Yuan died, Kong Zi said: 'Heaven bereaves me!'

sentences.zh: 及西狩見麟，曰：「吾道窮矣！」

translations.literal: When west hunt saw qilin, said: 'My way exhausted!'
translations.idiomatic: When he went west hunting and saw the qilin, he said: 'My way is exhausted!'

sentences.zh: 喟然嘆曰：「莫知我夫！」

translations.literal: Sighed deeply said: 'None know me!'
translations.idiomatic: He sighed deeply and said: 'No one knows me!'

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「何為莫知子？」

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: 'Why none know master?'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Gong said: 'Why does no one know the master?'

sentences.zh: 子曰：「不怨天，不尤人，下學而上達，知我者其天乎！」

translations.literal: Master said: 'Not resent heaven, not blame people, learn below reach above, know me heaven!'
translations.idiomatic: The master said: 'I do not resent heaven, do not blame people. Learn below and reach above. The one who knows me - is it heaven?'

translations.literal: Lu Ai Gong fourteenth year spring, hunted Great Wilds. Shusun family charioteer Zi Chu Shang captured beast, considered inauspicious. Zhong Ni viewed it, said: 'A qilin.' Took it. Said: 'River does not produce diagram, Luo does not produce book, I am finished!' Yan Yuan died, Confucius said: 'Heaven destroys me!' When western hunt saw qilin, said: 'My Way is exhausted!' Sighed deeply: 'None know me!' Zi Gong said: 'Why none know master?' Said: 'Not resent heaven, not blame people, study below reach above, those who know me, heaven!'

sentences.zh: 「不降其志，不辱其身，伯夷、叔齊乎！」

translations.literal: 'Not lower their will, not disgrace their person, Bo Yi, Shu Qi!'
translations.idiomatic: 'They did not lower their will, did not disgrace their person - Bo Yi and Shu Qi!'

sentences.zh: 謂「柳下惠、少連降志辱身矣」。

translations.literal: Said 'Liu Xia Hui, Shao Lian lowered will disgraced person.'
translations.idiomatic: He said 'Liu Xia Hui and Shao Lian lowered their will and disgraced their person.'

sentences.zh: 謂「虞仲、夷逸隱居放言，行中清，廢中權」。

translations.literal: Said 'Yu Zhong, Yi Yi hidden dwelt free speech, conduct middle purity, dismissal middle balance.'
translations.idiomatic: He said 'Yu Zhong and Yi Yi hid in dwelling and spoke freely. Their conduct was pure in the middle, their dismissal balanced in the middle.'

sentences.zh: 「我則異於是，無可無不可。」

translations.literal: 'I then different from this, no can no cannot.'
translations.idiomatic: 'I am different from this - no can, no cannot.'

translations.literal: 'Not lower their will, not disgrace their person, Bo Yi, Shu Qi!' Said 'Liu Xia Hui, Shao Lian lowered will disgraced person.' Said 'Yu Zhong, Yi Yi hidden dwelling loose words, conduct midst pure, abandoned midst balance'. 'I then different from this, no can no cannot.'

sentences.zh: 子曰：「弗乎弗乎，君子病沒世而名不稱焉。

translations.literal: Master said: 'Alas alas, gentleman grieves die world name not match.
translations.idiomatic: The master said: 'Alas, alas! The gentleman grieves that when he dies, his name does not match his reality.'

sentences.zh: 吾道不行矣，吾何以自見於後世哉？」

translations.literal: My way not practiced, I how self appear future generations?'
translations.idiomatic: My way is not practiced. How can I show myself to future generations?'

sentences.zh: 乃因史記作春秋，上至隱公，下訖哀公十四年，十二公。

translations.literal: Thus he used the scribe's records to make the Spring and Autumn Annals, above reaching Yin Gong, below ending with Ai Gong's fourteenth year, twelve dukes.

sentences.zh: 據魯，親周，故殷，運之三代。

translations.literal: Based on Lu, close to Zhou, honored Yin, circulated through the three dynasties.

sentences.zh: 約其文辭而指博。

translations.literal: Its literary words are concise but its meaning is broad.

sentences.zh: 故吳楚之君自稱王，而春秋貶之曰「子」；

translations.literal: Thus Wu Chu lords self called king, Spring Autumn demoted called 'zi';
translations.idiomatic: Thus the Wu and Chu lords called themselves king, but the Spring and Autumn Annals demoted them to 'zi.'

sentences.zh: 踐土之會實召周天子，而春秋諱之曰「天王狩於河陽」：推此類以繩當世。

translations.literal: Jian Tu meeting actually summoned Zhou Son of Heaven, Spring Autumn avoided called 'Heaven king hunted He Yang': extended this class rope current age.
translations.idiomatic: The Jian Tu meeting actually summoned the Zhou Son of Heaven, but the Spring and Autumn Annals avoided it by calling it 'The Heaven King hunted at He Yang': extending this class to regulate the current age.'

sentences.zh: 貶損之義，後有王者舉而開之。

translations.literal: The righteousness of demoting and harming - later kings will raise and open it.'

sentences.zh: 春秋之義行，則天下亂臣賊子懼焉。

translations.literal: When the righteousness of the Spring and Autumn Annals is practiced, then the world's chaotic ministers and bandit sons will fear there.

Said: 'Alas alas, gentleman grieves dying in age and name not fitting. My Way not practiced, how can I appear to later generations?' Thus based on historical records composed Spring and Autumn, above to Yin Gong, below ends Ai Gong fourteenth year, twelve dukes. Based on Lu, close to Zhou, thus Yin, moved through three dynasties. Concised their words pointed broadly. Therefore Wu Chu lords self-called kings, but Spring and Autumn demoted them as 'zi'; Jian Tu meeting actually summoned Zhou Son of Heaven, but Spring and Autumn euphemized as 'Heavenly King hunted at He Yang': push this category to bind the present age. Demote damage meanings, later kings will raise and expand them. Spring and Autumn meanings practiced, then All Under Heaven's rebellious ministers and villainous sons fear.

sentences.zh: 孔子在位聽訟，文辭有可與人共者，弗獨有也。

translations.literal: When Kong Zi was in position hearing lawsuits, he shared literary words that could be shared with others. He did not keep them alone.

sentences.zh: 至於為春秋，筆則筆，削則削，子夏之徒不能贊一辭。

translations.literal: When it came to making the Spring and Autumn Annals, he wrote what should be written, cut what should be cut. Zi Xia's followers could not add a single word.

sentences.zh: 弟子受春秋，孔子曰：「後世知丘者以春秋，而罪丘者亦以春秋。」

translations.literal: Disciples received Spring Autumn, Kong Zi said: 'Future generations know Qiu with Spring Autumn, blame Qiu also with Spring Autumn.'
translations.idiomatic: When the disciples received the Spring and Autumn Annals, Kong Zi said: 'Future generations who know Qiu will do so through the Spring and Autumn Annals, and those who blame Qiu will also do so through the Spring and Autumn Annals.'

translations.literal: Confucius in position heard lawsuits, literary phrases had what could be shared with others, not possessed alone. As for composing the Spring and Autumn Annals, what should be written was written, what should be deleted was deleted, even Zi Xia's disciples could not add a single word. The disciples received the Spring and Autumn Annals, Confucius said: 'Later generations who know Qiu will do so through the Spring and Autumn Annals, and those who condemn Qiu will also do so through the Spring and Autumn Annals.'

sentences.zh: 明歲，子路死於衛。

translations.literal: The next year, Zi Lu died in Wei.

sentences.zh: 孔子病，子貢請見。

translations.literal: Kong Zi was ill, and Zi Gong requested to see him.

sentences.zh: 孔子方負杖逍遙於門，曰：「賜，汝來何其晚也？」

translations.literal: Kong Zi just leaning staff strolling at gate, said: 'Ci, you come why so late?'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi was just leaning on his staff, strolling at the gate. He said: 'Ci, why have you come so late?'

sentences.zh: 孔子因歎，歌曰：「太山壞乎！

translations.literal: Kong Zi thus sighed, sang said: 'Tai Shan collapse!
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi thus sighed and sang: 'Tai Shan is collapsing!'

sentences.zh: 梁柱摧乎！

translations.literal: Rafters pillars collapse!
translations.idiomatic: Rafters and pillars are collapsing!'

sentences.zh: 哲人萎乎！」

translations.literal: Wise person withered!'
translations.idiomatic: The wise person is withered!'

sentences.zh: 因以涕下。

translations.literal: Thus tears fell.

sentences.zh: 謂子貢曰：「天下無道久矣，莫能宗予。

translations.literal: Told Zi Gong said: 'World without way long already, none can take me as ancestor.
translations.idiomatic: He told Zi Gong: 'The world has been without the way for a long time. No one can take me as their ancestor.'

sentences.zh: 夏人殯於東階，周人於西階，殷人兩柱閒。

translations.literal: Xia people encoffined at the east steps, Zhou people at the west steps, Yin people between the two pillars.'

sentences.zh: 昨暮予夢坐奠兩柱之閒，予始殷人也。」

translations.literal: Yesterday evening I dreamed sat sacrifice between two pillars, I originally Yin person.'
translations.idiomatic: Yesterday evening I dreamed I sat in sacrifice between the two pillars. I am originally a Yin person.'

sentences.zh: 後七日卒。

translations.literal: After seven days he died.

The next year, Zi Lu died in Wei. Confucius fell ill, Zi Gong requested to see him. Confucius was leaning on his staff strolling at the gate, said: 'Ci, why have you come so late?' Confucius thus sighed, sang: 'Great Mountain collapses! Rafters break! Wise man withers!' Thus tears flowed down. He told Zi Gong: 'The world has lacked the Way for a long time, none can follow me. Xia people encoffined on the eastern steps, Zhou people on the western steps, Yin people between the two pillars. Last night I dreamed I sat enshrined between the two pillars, I began as a Yin person.' After seven days he died.

sentences.zh: 孔子年七十三，以魯哀公十六年四月己丑卒。

translations.literal: Kong Zi was seventy-three years old. He died in Lu Ai Gong's sixteenth year, fourth month, Ji Chou day.
Confucius was seventy-three years old, died in the fourth month on ji-chou day of Duke Ai of Lu's sixteenth year.

sentences.zh: 哀公誄之曰：「旻天不弔，不愸遺一老，俾屏余一人以在位，煢煢余在疚。

translations.literal: Ai Gong eulogized him said: 'Dark heaven not pity, not compassionate left one old, made abandon me one person in position, lonely I in sorrow.
translations.idiomatic: Ai Gong eulogized him, saying: 'Dark heaven does not pity, not compassionate in leaving one old man. It has made me abandoned, one person in position. Lonely I am in sorrow.'

sentences.zh: 嗚呼哀哉！

translations.literal: Alas sorrow!
translations.idiomatic: Alas, sorrow!'

sentences.zh: 尼父，毋自律！」

translations.literal: Ni father, do not restrain yourself!'

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「君其不沒於魯乎！

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: 'Lord perhaps not submerged in Lu!
translations.idiomatic: Zi Gong said: 'The lord will perhaps not be submerged in obscurity in Lu!'

sentences.zh: 夫子之言曰：『禮失則昬，名失則愆。

translations.literal: Master words said: 'Ritual lost then blind, name lost then error.
translations.idiomatic: The master's words said: 'When ritual is lost then blind, when name is lost then error.'

sentences.zh: 失志為昬，失所為愆。』

translations.literal: Lost will blind, lost place error.'
translations.idiomatic: Lost will is blind, lost place is error.'

sentences.zh: 生不能用，死而誄之，非禮也。

translations.literal: When alive he could not employ him, but when dead he eulogizes him - this is not ritual.'

sentences.zh: 稱『余一人』，非名也。」

translations.literal: Called 'I one person', not name.'
translations.idiomatic: To call himself 'I one person' is not the proper name.'

translations.literal: Duke Ai eulogized him saying: 'Heaven does not bless, does not pity and leave one elder, causing me alone to remain in position, solitary I am in mourning. Alas, alas! Ni Father, do not restrain yourself!' Zi Gong said: 'Your lordship will not be forgotten in Lu! The Master's words say: "When ritual is lost then confusion, when names are lost then error. Losing the will is confusion, losing the place is error."' While alive he could not be employed, when dead he is eulogized, this is not ritual. Calling himself 'I alone', this is not the name.'

sentences.zh: 孔子葬魯城北泗上，弟子皆服三年。

translations.literal: Kong Zi was buried north of Lu city on the Si. His disciples all mourned for three years.

sentences.zh: 三年心喪畢，相訣而去，則哭，各復盡哀；

translations.literal: Three years heart mourning finished, bid farewell departed, then cried, each again exhausted grief;
translations.idiomatic: When the three years of heart mourning finished, they bid farewell and departed. Then they cried, each again exhausting their grief.

sentences.zh: 或復留。

translations.literal: Some again stayed.

sentences.zh: 唯子貢廬於冢上，凡六年，然後去。

translations.literal: Only Zi Gong hutted above the tomb for altogether six years, then left.

sentences.zh: 弟子及魯人往從冢而家者百有餘室，因命曰孔里。

translations.literal: Disciples and Lu people who went and followed the tomb to make homes numbered over a hundred rooms. Thus it was named Kong li.

sentences.zh: 魯世世相傳以歲時奉祠孔子冢，而諸儒亦講禮鄉飲大射於孔子冢。

translations.literal: Lu generation after generation mutually transmitted offerings to sacrifice at Kong Zi's tomb with the seasons. The various scholars also discussed ritual, village drinking, and grand archery at Kong Zi's tomb.

sentences.zh: 孔子冢大一頃。

translations.literal: Kong Zi's tomb was large, one qing.

sentences.zh: 故所居堂弟子內，後世因廟藏孔子衣冠琴車書，至于漢二百餘年不絕。

translations.literal: Therefore, in the hall where he resided, the disciples were inside. Later generations thus stored Kong Zi's clothes, caps, zither, carriage, and books in the temple, continuing to the Han for over two hundred years without ceasing.

sentences.zh: 高皇帝過魯，以太牢祠焉。

translations.literal: The High Emperor passed through Lu and sacrificed there with great penned animals.

sentences.zh: 諸侯卿相至，常先謁然後從政。

translations.literal: When feudal lords, ministers, and premiers arrived, they often first visited then engaged in government.

Confucius was buried north of Lu city on the Si River, disciples all mourned for three years. After three years the mourning in heart was complete, they bid farewell and left, then wept, each exhausting their grief; some remained again. Only Zi Gong built a hut on the tomb, for six years in all, then left. Disciples and Lu people who moved to live by the tomb numbered over one hundred households, thus named Kong Village. Lu generation after generation transmitted to offer sacrifice to Confucius's tomb at the seasons, while Confucian scholars also lectured on ritual, rural feasts, and great archery at Confucius's tomb. Confucius's tomb was one qing in size. Therefore in the hall where he resided among disciples, later generations accordingly made a temple to store Confucius's clothes, hat, zither, chariot, books, continuing to the Han for over two hundred years without cease. The Supreme Emperor passed through Lu, sacrificed to him with the great牢. Feudal lords and ministers arriving, always first visited then conducted affairs.

sentences.zh: 孔子生鯉，字伯魚。

translations.literal: Kong Zi gave birth to Li, styled Bo Yu.

sentences.zh: 伯魚年五十，先孔子死。

translations.literal: Bo Yu was fifty years old when he died before Kong Zi.
Confucius fathered Li, styled Bo Yu. Bo Yu at age fifty died before Confucius.

sentences.zh: 伯魚生伋，字子思，年六十二。

translations.literal: Bo Yu gave birth to Ji, styled Zi Si, who was sixty-two years old.

sentences.zh: 嘗困於宋。

translations.literal: He was once distressed in Song.

sentences.zh: 子思作中庸。

translations.literal: Zi Si composed the Doctrine of the Mean.
Bo Yu fathered Ji, styled Zi Si, age sixty-two. Once was besieged in Song. Zi Si composed the Doctrine of the Mean.

sentences.zh: 子思生白，字子上，年四十七。

translations.literal: Zi Si gave birth to Bai, styled Zi Shang, who was forty-seven years old.

sentences.zh: 子上生求，字子家，年四十五。

translations.literal: Zi Shang gave birth to Qiu, styled Zi Jia, who was forty-five years old.

sentences.zh: 子家生箕，字子京，年四十六。

translations.literal: Zi Jia gave birth to Ji, styled Zi Jing, who was forty-six years old.

sentences.zh: 子京生穿，字子高，年五十一。

translations.literal: Zi Jing gave birth to Chuan, styled Zi Gao, who was fifty-one years old.

sentences.zh: 子高生子慎，年五十七，嘗為魏相。

translations.literal: Zi Gao gave birth to Zi Shen, who was fifty-seven years old and once was Wei chancellor.

Zi Si fathered Bai, styled Zi Shang, age forty-seven. Zi Shang fathered Qiu, styled Zi Jia, age forty-five. Zi Jia fathered Ji, styled Zi Jing, age forty-six. Zi Jing fathered Chuan, styled Zi Gao, age fifty-one. Zi Gao fathered Chong, styled Zi Gao, age fifty-seven, once served as Wei chancellor.

sentences.zh: 子慎生鮒，年五十七，為陳王涉博士，死於陳下。

translations.literal: Zi Shen gave birth to Fu, who was fifty-seven years old, was Chen king She's doctor, and died below Chen.
Zi Gao fathered Fu, age fifty-seven, died in Chen serving Chen King Fu as doctor.

sentences.zh: 鮒弟子襄，年五十七。

translations.literal: Fu's disciple Xiang was fifty-seven years old.

sentences.zh: 嘗為孝惠皇帝博士，遷為長沙太守。

translations.literal: He once was the Filial Hui emperor's doctor and was moved to become Changsha grand guardian.

sentences.zh: 長九尺六寸。

translations.literal: He was nine chi six cun tall.
Fu's disciple Xiang, age fifty-seven. Once served as doctor to Emperor Hui of Han, moved to become governor of Changsha. Nine chi six cun tall.

sentences.zh: 子襄生忠，年五十七。

translations.literal: Zi Xiang gave birth to Zhong, who was fifty-seven years old.

sentences.zh: 忠生武，武生延年及安國。

translations.literal: Zhong gave birth to Wu. Wu gave birth to Yan Nian and An Guo.

sentences.zh: 安國為今皇帝博士，至臨淮太守，蚤卒。

translations.literal: An Guo was the current emperor's doctor and reached the position of Lin Huai grand guardian, dying early.

sentences.zh: 安國生卬，卬生驩。

translations.literal: An Guo gave birth to Ang. Ang gave birth to Huan.

Zi Xiang fathered Zhong, age fifty-seven. Zhong fathered Wu, Wu fathered Yan Nian and An Guo. An Guo served as doctor to the current emperor, went to be governor of Linhuai, died young. An Guo fathered Ang, Ang fathered Huan.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：《詩》有之：「高山仰止，景行行止。」

translations.literal: Grand scribe said: 'Poetry has it: 'High mountain gaze stop, bright conduct walk stop.'
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Scribe said: 'The Poetry has it: "High mountain to gaze at and stop. Bright conduct to walk and stop."'

sentences.zh: 雖不能至，然心鄉往之。

translations.literal: Though one cannot reach it, yet the heart faces and goes toward it.'

sentences.zh: 余讀孔氏書，想見其為人。

translations.literal: I read the Kong clan's books and imagine seeing his person.'

sentences.zh: 適魯，觀仲尼廟堂車服禮器，諸生以時習禮其家，余祗回留之不能去云。

translations.literal: I went to Lu and viewed Zhong Ni's temple hall, carriage, clothes, and ritual vessels. The various scholars practiced ritual at his home with the seasons. I reverently turned and stayed, unable to leave.'

sentences.zh: 天下君王至於賢人眾矣，當時則榮，沒則已焉。

translations.literal: The world's lords and kings, as well as worthy people, have been many. In their time they were glorious, but when they died it stopped there.'

sentences.zh: 孔子布衣，傳十餘世，學者宗之。

translations.literal: Kong Zi was in common clothes. He has been transmitted for over ten generations, and scholars take him as their ancestor.'

sentences.zh: 自天子王侯，中國言六藝者折中於夫子，可謂至聖矣！

translations.literal: From Son of Heaven kings marquises, central states speak six arts ones judge standard at master, can call utmost sage!
translations.idiomatic: From the Son of Heaven to kings and marquises, those in the central states who speak of the six arts judge their standards by the Master. He can truly be called the utmost sage!'

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: 'The Poetry says: "High mountains look up to them and stop, shining paths walk them and stop." Though unable to reach them, the heart turns toward them. I read Confucius's books, imagine seeing his person. Went to Lu, observed Confucius's temple hall carriage robes ritual vessels, the disciples with the times practice ritual in his home, I reverently lingered and could not leave. The world has many kings and worthy people, when alive they are honored, when dead they end. Confucius as commoner, transmitted for over ten generations, scholars revere him. From kings and nobles of China, those speaking of the six arts take Confucius as the standard, can be called the utmost sage!'
